title: Aggregate totals page issues
body:
Some of the data on the aggregate totals page is not being displayed properly.

Bars under expertise level go over 100% and outside the bounds of the bar Some values are not calculated properly and show "Infinity%"

The PDF export does not contain the bars from the bargraph The PDF export shows the doughnut chart blurry and not rendered properly The PDF export does not render the legend properly Tech_Assessment.pdf

The "Group" dropdown needs to be included. When a secondary group is selected we need to display the bars as stacked bars for that group and a doughnut chart for each group value.

title: Add buttons to navigate to prev/next files in the changeset
body:
Describe the bug

From the client

After I filter and select the commits I want to review I do see the list of files that have changed across these commits - After I open one file I can click thru each change — What I cannot do is continue to click thru to the next changed file in the list; instead I have to close the editor and click another file to open a new diff view.

We need to add two buttons to navigate to the prev/next files in the changeset.

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

  1. Go to the GitLens options
  2. Click on the search button to open the new UI
  3. Select one or several commits.
  4. Click one file of the diff window and open the diff details.
  5. Should add two buttons to navigate to the prev/next files in the toolbar.

Expected behavior

Should add two buttons to navigate to the prev/next files in the toolbar.

If the current file is the first file in the change set, disable the button which navigates to the prev file. If the current file is the last file in the change set, disable the button which navigates to the next file.

Screenshots

See above

To Reproduce

  1. Go to the GitLens options

Also I'll add an option to keep apps open (currently it quits directly, and re-opens). Probably when this works done, these bugs will also resolved.

title: Filter out merge commits
body:
When you do a merge from one branch to another branch you will create a merge commit that marks that a merge has occurred, along with listing all the new commits included with the merge. This creates a new commit sha1 for the merge commit.

In the Bitbucket website, merge commits are marked with an M icon.

Merge commits don't contain actual changes so we don't need to care about them. We need to add a checkbox in the commits view GUI to filter out all the merge commits. If the checkbox is checked, all merge commits are removed from the commit lists.

You can test with this repo, I created many merge commits via merging your pull request.

title: Full support of Bitbucket V1 & V2 API
body:
In the current code, V1 and V2 APIs are partially supported, some services use V1 API, some services uses V2 API, see the code in https://github.com/billsedison/vscode-gitlens/blob/tc-dev/src/gitCommentService.ts, where editComment and deleteComment use V1 API, rest services use V2 API.

But we would like to support V1 & V2 API fully, i.e., all services should use either V1 APIs or V2 APIs. No mixture of use is allowed. You should add a boolean variable useApiV2 in a configuration file to switch the API version.

Note: the V1 API will be removed on Dec 31, 2018, but the client still has some repositories that reply on V1 API so we still need to support it fully.

Reference: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/?utm_source=%2Fbitbucket&utm_medium=302

title: Replace the hover window with an external electron app to make the user experience better.
body:
Describe the bug

Currently, the comments are shown in the hover window, it is ok but not good at the user experience. Here are some existing issues

(1) On the left document, the hover window is easily popup, but on the right document, it's a bit harder.

(2) The hover window is too small to show comments.

(3) When you move the mouse, the hover window is easily disappeared.

We would like to replace the hover window with an external electron app. So that all these issues will be resolved and the user experience will be better.

The new app should be triggered by clicking a button, the button can be put on the toolbar on the top or any other place that can be clicked easily. For example, if the cursor is in the 7th line, then click the button, the comment of the 7th line should be shown in the app.

If and only 1 electron app can be open at the same time. If the app has been open, then the cursor is moved to a different line, when I click the button again, the comment of that line should be shown in the app.

Note: we have added a new electron app for editing comments. You can take this PR as a reference.

You can also see the discussion on this ticket https://gitlab.com/aggregated-git-diff/aggregated-git-diff-bug-bash/issues/5

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

  1. Go to the GitLens options
  2. Click on the search button to open the new UI
  3. Select one or several commits.
  4. Click one file of the diff window and open the diff details.
  5. Hover on a commit and see the hover window appears.
  6. Login to your Bitbucket account if necessary.

Expected behavior

Replace the hover window with an external electron app to resolve all the issues mentioned above. Add

title: Add an external page for login
body:
Describe the bug Currently, if you don't log in to Bitbucket, the login popup will appear when you tried to show the inline comment or file-level comment. This is good. However, the username and password inputs are separated into two different popups. Sometimes, the password popup appears even I didn't finish the input of the username. It may be caused by the mouse is moved accidentally or something.

So we need to use an external page to replace the popup for login. The external page should be open when (1) fetching the comment if you didn't log in to Bitbucket yet. (the same as the current workflow). (2) clicking an external button

Note: the 2nd placement submission added an external login page, you can refer the code.

To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:

  1. Go to the GitLens options
  2. Click on the search button to open the new UI
  3. Select one or several commits.
  4. Click one file of the diff window and open the diff details.
  5. Hover on a commit.
  6. Login to your Bitbucket account.

Screenshots The external login page can be shown like below.

title: Add two new boolean flags to UserAdminAssignment entity
body:
• Add two new boolean properties to support https://marvelapp.com/3i7ed2a/screen/47331602 (queryNotify and eventNotify).
  1. Update EventQueryService#create to send emails to Admins where UserAdminAssignment queryNotify is true
  2. Update EventService#(create/update) to send emails to Admins where UserAdminAssignment eventNotify is true. Filter admin creating/updating event.
  • Sending email should be done in background to not block Web response.

Support frontend integration

title: Fold and expand folders in the file tree nodes
body:
Describe the bug

Currently, the folder in the tree nodes can't be folded or expanded. We should support this feature.

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

  1. Go to the GitLens options
  2. Click on the search button to open the new UI
  3. Select one or several commits.
  4. Click the folder in the file tree nodes
  5. The folder can't be folded or expanded, and an error message is prompted.

Expected behavior

The folder should be folded or expanded by clicking it.

Screenshots

See https://monosnap.com/file/K1y00oQvQ2jw7SURdbnQcs8YmsFm9g

title: Make the commits panel and file tree node panel resizable
body:
The client requested to make the commits panel and file tree node panel resizable so that they can adjust a comfortable size. For example, expand the left panel to reduce the line wrapping.

Please add a bar in the middle of these two panels, so that we can drag it and resize the two panels.

title: Android Remote :  Intermittently the Number keys are not responding.
body:
In Android Remote, while continuosly entering different numbers in numerical keys (For example, 0123456789), 2 or 3 numbers are not displayed. ie.,Intermittently the number keys are not responding. Reproducible in both Mac and STB.

This issue is not observed when selecting the numbers in soft keyboard.

title: "Show Merge Commits" tweak
body:
We added a checkbox "Show Merge Commits" to the search view page for showing/hiding merge commits.

See details in https://gitlab.com/aggregated-git-diff/aggregated-git-diff-bug-bash/issues/18

We would like to do some tweaks to make the user experience better.

(1) Add an icon Ⓜ in front of the merge commit. You can use this special character as the icon.

So that the merge commits are easily recognizable.

(2) Make the "Show Merge Commits" checkbox checked by default, so that we can show all commits by default.

(3) Currently, if we need to hide/show merge commits, we need to uncheck/check the "Show Merge Commits" checkbox then click the "Search" button. It's too cumbersome. Let's simplify the step by just unchecking/checking the checkbox. That is, uncheck/check the "Show Merge Commits" checkbox should hide/show merge commits, no need to click the "Search" button anymore.

title: Make the text of commits wrap with the width of the left panel
body:
We added a bar to resize the width of the left/right panel of the search view, see https://gitlab.com/aggregated-git-diff/aggregated-git-diff-bug-bash/issues/23

But after this fix, the texts of commits in the left never wrap, instead, the panel is horizontally scrollable.

We would like to make the text wrap. Because the text will be cut by default and users might not know the panel is horizontally scrollable.

title: Display the full message of commits
body:
From the client

In IntelliJ, when viewing a merge commit I can see the details of what files changed and all the commit messages included in the merge.

In VSCode - the details of the merge commit are minimal.

This is because our extended GitLens only displays part of the message of each commit and omit the rest part if the message is too long.

We should display the full message instead of omitting part of it.

title: Show all branches that include the merge commit
body:
From the client

In IntelliJ — I can even see a list of all the branches that include this merge of commits.

We should include this info in the extended VSCode GitLens.

Only merge commits are in scope.

title: Merge in changes and fixes for review issues
body:
We need to create a merge request to:

  1. Merge in the updates from the latest challenge.
  2. Fix the review issues below:

Review issues

  1. The shadow undernath the toggle circle seems to be a bit wonky. It's not fitting the circle like it should: https://www.dropbox.com/s/w3yh66gxdj7oq7m/Screen%20Shot%202018-10-18%20at%205.41.06%20pm.png?dl=1

  2. The font faces look alright, but they look to be one or two points smaller in the submission than they are in the marvel app and designs.

  3. In the Job Details section, there are some spacing differences at the top between the submission and the marvel app designs. Submission on left, Marvel on right: https://www.dropbox.com/s/ctqona7i7e84rbc/Screen%20Shot%202018-10-18%20at%205.44.18%20pm.png?dl=1

  4. The "Edit Job Details" and "Export to CSV" icons are a little blurry / stretched on a HiDPI screen: https://www.dropbox.com/s/y4iudri617qfxi4/Screen%20Shot%202018-10-18%20at%205.45.20%20pm.png?dl=1

  5. When editing job details, the left padding of the text in the fields is a bit more, causing them to overflow on the right. Marvel on left, submission on right: https://www.dropbox.com/s/dbdr6keq77z902s/Screen%20Shot%202018-10-18%20at%205.46.36%20pm.png?dl=1

  6. We should get some better example photos into the sample job details, just for display to the client (Recommended)

  7. The video display isn't really done (https://marvelapp.com/4hi5cia/screen/47944436). I don't anticipate this being a problem with the client, so we'll leave this as a minor issue for now.

  8. The layers toggles look a bit cutoff: https://www.dropbox.com/s/6izd6jcz6nuybdk/Screen%20Shot%202018-10-18%20at%205.50.37%20pm.png?dl=1

  9. The layout and colouring of the Layers panel isn't quite right. Problems I see:

  • Layer should be Layers
  • The font for Layer isn't correct
  • The close button has a shadow that's not in the design
  • The section titles have a gray background, but that's not implemented in the submission.

See the marvel app on the left vs. the submission on the right: https://www.dropbox.com/s/co9rmgkxmmks6tw/Screen%20Shot%202018-10-18%20at%205.50.55%20pm.png?dl=1

  1. "Disasters" and "Disaster" is spelled wrong in the filter panel.

  2. The "Export Attachments" button on the list view has an artefact on the bottom of the graphic: https://www.dropbox.com/s/lh0be0l5jytvabp/Screen%20Shot%202018-10-18%20at%206.03.48%20pm.png?dl=1

  3. "MAP VIEW" and "LIST VIEW" in the header should be bold font style, and there shouldn't be a gap between the blue underline and the content underneath: https://www.dropbox.com/s/98ap9corib7pznc/Screen%20Shot%202018-10-18%20at%206.05.03%20pm.png?dl=1

  4. I think we need a lot more comments in the CSS file. We need to know what screen elements are affected by what styles, especially since this will all be further integrated into an actual app by the client. They will need to know what's important and what can be modified / split out into separate files.

1. Update to latest models (Check swagger and postman).

  2. Add support for waiting list. Check iOS issue - https://gitlab.com/wipro-caas/wipro-tasks/issues/40.

  3. When creating event attendee a ticket and payment option needs to be selected. Those are embedded into event object. Mobile already has this screen to select ticket and payment option. Just need to hook with backend. If ticket is free payment option can be null.

  4. Add live chat support when event is live (ongoing) - backend is done (Socket.io). Admin frontend has already advanced development for that one.

title: Implement delegate access level
body:
• Enforce UserAccessRole using a Store Procedure.

  • Update SecurityConfig to enforce ADMIN, SUPER_ADMIN roles.

  • UserRole summary:

1. User.role can be SUPER_ADMIN, ADMIN or USER (this is to allow login to Admin web).
2. UserAdminAssignment.role can be ADMIN, ORGANIZER or CREW (this is to associate with Company).
3. UserEventAssignment.role can be ORGANIZER or CREW (this is to associate with a given event) - Organizers/Crew can perform operations on the events they created. Every time they create an event a UserEventAssignment is created.
4. UserSessionAssignment.role can be SPEAKER.

  • UserRole is the role of the user in company/event/session.

  • UserAccessRole is what an user that has UserAdminAssignment can do.

  • Before performing an action should check UserAccessRole to check permission.

title: Javascript error prompts when closing the comments list window while it's loading
body:
Describe the bug

If I close the comments list window while the comments are loading, a Javascript error prompts.

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

  1. Go to the GitLens options
  2. Click on the search button to open the new UI
  3. Select one or several commits.
  4. Click one file of the diff window and open the diff details.
  5. Login to bitbucket if necessary
  6. Click the blue or red icon on the top toolbar to view the inline or file-level comment
  7. When the comments are loading, click the "Close" button.
  8. You will see a Javascript error window prompted.

Expected behavior

We should be able to close the window successfully while the comments are loading, the Javascript errors should be eliminated. The corresponding API request should be canceled.

Screenshots

  • OS: All
  • Browser N/A

title: Add more meaningful logs for helping to investigate the failure of V1 API from client
body:
Our client uses an internal Bitbucket repo, which is named Bitbucket Data Center. He faced an issue that Bitbucket V1 API doesn't work at all.

Unfortunately, we can't access this internal repo because it must be accessed via their VPN and under their firewall. But they would like we can investigate the reason and better to resolve this issue.

Here is the information from the client.

Client

The big problem at this point is that it only supports Bitbucket Cloud (Rest API v2). I need it to also support Bitbucket Data Center (Rest API v1). There may be an issue we have to work thru dealing with access to the Repo thru a firewall — When I login thru web interface I have to double authenticate — this may block simply auth creds from REST http call. I am not sure about this. As long as I am on a VPN it should not matter, but I have seen the browser bounce me thru an SSO site to authenticate and set a cookie. This will require some research.

billsedison

Yes, but I can’t reproduce the problem because I only have a repo on bitbucket.org, which works well on both Rest API v1 and v2. Can you set up a repo on Bitbucket Data Center for me? So that we can reproduce the problem you met and resolve it.

Client

can setup the repo, but how are you going to access it? You need to be inside the VPN / Firewall to login…

billsedison

That is a problem… Or can you elaborate on the detailed failures on v1 API? For example, are you able to login to Bitbucket via v1 API? Are there any errors you met?

Client

no errors. the debug console simply spits out the credentials json (I assume that was sent to bitbucket for login) simply opening a diff view of a file gives this result in debug console: and clicking blue icon to view line comments gives this in child window:

Please investigate the possible failure by reading the code.

You can add just more meaning logs for the promise failure so that the client can know what the failure is.

title: Close the editing window while closing the comments list window.
body:
Describe the bug

When the comments list window and the editing window are both open, if I just close the comments list window, the editing window will be still open. Which is wrong. We need to close the editing window while closing the comments list window.

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

  1. Go to the GitLens options
  2. Click on the search button to open the new UI
  3. Select one or several commits.
  4. Click one file of the diff window and open the diff details.
  5. Login to the bitbucket if necessary
  6. Click on the red or blue icon to view the file-level or inline comment, then the comments list window will be open.
  7. Click "Add comment" or "Reply"/"Edit" button, then the editing window will be open.
  8. Focus back to the comments list window, close it.
  9. You see the editing window is still there.

Expected behavior

We need to close the editing window while closing the comments list window.

Screenshots

https://monosnap.com/file/f6ge0Pgf6Ca3REblAFkZmontHN3CGI

Desktop (please complete the following information):

  • OS: All
  • Browser N/A
  • Version All

title: Reduce the load time of v2 API
body:
As discussed in https://gitlab.com/aggregated-git-diff/aggregated-git-diff-bug-bash/issues/41

There is actually nothing about anyone's commit. It's completely related to BitBucket API. (v1 and v2)

https://github.com/billsedison/vscode-gitlens/commit/efc9e9fe0db9d797eec1150fd49627932bcdf175#diff-b9cfc7f2cdf78a7f4b91a753d10865a2L1428

Here you can see, after that change, the extension uses v2 API default. v1 API returns all comments in one response, therefore one API request is enough for V1. However, for v2, you need to send a request per 10 comments. It only returns 10 comments in one response. For example, if there are 63 comments (deleted ones also returned) we need to send 7 requests to V2 endpoint.

Each response has a field called 'next' that pointing to the next page containing the rest of comments.

Details: https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commit/%7Bnode%7D/comments#get

I'll make some modifications at GitCommentService:loadComments method to handle multiple V2 requests asynchronously.

Question from billsedison

Will it be helpful to reduce the load time? If multiple V2 requests are sent simultaneously, but the response order is undetermined. You still need to wait for the all requests completed and reorder the received comments before showing them on screen, correct?

title: Make the API V1BaseURL and V2BaseURL configurable
body:
From the client

The V1 API is like https://bitbucket.corporate.tmo.com/rest/api/1.0/projects/{projectKey}/repos/{repositorySlug}/{api-endpoint}

so, to get a list of pull-requests for the tmo-aem-ui repo in the TMO project we would call: https://bitbucket.corporate.tmo.com/rest/api/1.0/projects/TMO/repos/tmo-aem-ui/pull-requests

to get only the open pull requests : https://bitbucket.corporate.tmo.com/rest/api/1.0/projects/TMO/repos/tmo-aem-ui/pull-requests?direction=incoming&at=refs/heads/trunk&state=declined&order=newest&start=0&limit=50

Currently, the API base URL is hardcoded in https://github.com/billsedison/vscode-gitlens/blob/tc-dev/src/gitCommentService.ts#L47

We need to make V1BaseURL, V2BaseURL configurable, so that the client can configure these base URL freely.

Please also remove the domain replacement logic code

if (!isV2 && domain && domain !== 'bitbucket.org') {
  baseUrl = baseUrl.replace('bitbucket.org', domain);
}

Please also update the README for describing the configuration.

title: Change password prompt is closed because of the login history dialog box
body:
Steps to Reproduce

  1. Login as admin
  2. Menu > Settings > Users
  3. Click EDIT
  4. In the 'User Password Management'; select an user
  5. Enable Locked
  6. Click SAVE
  7. Try to Login from other user 2 times
  8. Now Diable lock and enable Require Password Change
  9. Click Save
  10. Try to login from other user and check
  11. Click on to the Login History dialog box and observe

Actual Result(s)

  • Change password prompt is closed because of the login history dialog box

Expected Result(s)

title: Widget Availability Empty Data Fixes
body:
The backend uses products/availability endpoint and returns the data like in the attached file, seems to be correct. product_availability_response.json

On the frontend there should be changes:

  • \RestClients\Impl\ProductClient.cs urlParams dates should be in format ToString("MM.dd.yyyy") - because on backend some dates are not parsed correctly and they become 01.01.01
  • Same file, ProductAvailabilityModel is not consistent with what is returned by backend. Properties need to be modified
  • Same file, there is no functionality for parsing the response and populating result (it is commented as TODO) - that's why default values(0) are set on the view

EXPECTED RESULT

  • Number of Instructor Availability displayed correct number
  • Number of Max Level Instructor displayed correct number
  • Create sample data from today to December 31st 2018
  • Make sure data divided on AM and PM
  • Create as much sample data as possible

title: Edit Reservation Functioanality Issue
body:
Situation 1. Steps to reproduce on dev branch:

  • Select reservation with additional skiers;
  • Click on Edit Reservation;
  • Remove all additional skiers;
  • click Save;
  • Result - skiers were not removed.

Situation 2. Steps to reproduce on dev branch:

  • Select reservation with 2 or more additional skiers;
  • Click on Edit Reservation;
  • Remove one additional skier;
  • click Save;
  • Result - you will have previous skiers and 1 extra skier.

Situation 3. Steps to reproduce on my branch:

  • Select reservation with additional skiers;
  • Click on Edit Reservation;
  • Edit information about some skiers;
  • click Save;
  • Result - existing skiers will not be edited, but the new with modified data will be created.
  • Fix all issues for different situation
  • You might need update the backend

title: Update layer setup in map.js
body:
From the client:

Check this https://sampleserver3.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/rest/services/Hydrography/Watershed173811/MapServer

This tells us the layers available, then we run the same to get data for specific layer

  • https://sampleserver3.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/rest/services/Hydrography/Watershed173811/MapServer/0 for Layer Waterbodies(0)
  • https://sampleserver3.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/rest/services/Hydrography/Watershed173811/MapServer/1 for Rivers(1)

That way we don't have to hard-code the number of layers like this:

      var rivers = new FeatureLayer("https://sampleserver3.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/rest/services/Hydrography/Watershed173811/MapServer/1", {
        mode: FeatureLayer.MODE_ONDEMAND,
        outFields: ["*"]
      });
      var waterbodies = new FeatureLayer("https://sampleserver3.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/rest/services/Hydrography/Watershed173811/MapServer/0", {
        mode: FeatureLayer.MODE_ONDEMAND,
        outFields: ["*"]
      });

...

      response.map.addLayers([waterbodies, rivers]);

We can query the layers from the map itself.

title: Replace UI elements with JQuery plugins
body:
We've been asked by the client to make loading data into the various controls easier for them by using JQuery type controls.

For instance, they'd like us to use one of these for the drop downs:

  • http://selectric.js.org/demo.html
  • https://hernansartorio.com/jquery-nice-select/

They have earmarked these elements for changes:

  • Dropdowns
  • Toggle buttons / checkboxes
  • Date controls
  • Checkboxes in list views

Let's try to use one of the two links for the drop downs, and I'm open to any suggestions on the others, as long as:

  1. The JQuery plugin used is currently maintained
  2. The licenses is either BSD or MIT

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Open the Application and login as a valid user [User 003][Role: Leader]
  2. Click Competencies > More
  3. Create Competency
  4. Create Sub Competency under that
  5. Create a level under that
  6. Create Activity under that one
  7. Now go to Manage > Employee Competency
  8. Expand the Competency > Sub Competency > Level > Activity
  9. Add some Employees using 'Add New Employee' option
  10. Click 'New Employee'
  11. Enter all the required data and enter invalid data to Employee EID
  12. Click Save

Actual Result(s)

  • No error message displayed when user enters invalid 'Employee EID'

Expected Result(s)

  • Should display an error message

Environment Details

  • Device(s): Laptop
  • Resolution: 1366 x 768
  • Operating System: Windows 7 64bit

Image(s)/Video(s)/Console Log/Crash Log

If attachment(s) is/are not here, Please check the comments section

title: Prototype updates
body:
From the client:

We have few issues with Status & Location controls in the Filters section :

Change 1

  1. The controls close as soon as the user clicks on a child checkbox. Both such controls should allow the user to select multiple (child) checkboxes & close only if the user clicks outside such controls or on Esc key press.

Change 2

  1. On doing $('.filterAside .drop-down.dropdown-status .selected-option').html(); & $('.filterAside .drop-down.dropdown-location .selected-option').html(); currently we are getting the text values of the selected checkboxes within these controls. We should be able to assign IDs (numeric backend values) to these checkboxes and should be able to get these numeric backend values of the selected checkboxes.

Change 3

  1. Intermediate state for header checkboxes in the Location control.

Change 4

  1. For both these controls on mouseover show all the display texts of the selected checkboxes as tooltip.

title: Convert panels on landing page
body:
On the landing page, there is a row of panels for Benefits, Diversity, and University Relation. We need to build this out on a DocDef / document using the standard layout tools of Zeta and a custom component.

The custom component should match one column of the row:

The component should have fields for the text, the Learn More URL, the background image, and the cell title.

Please also include documentation on how to:

  1. Create a DocDef that shows the 3 columns as shown on the landing page
  2. Set up the rows and columns so that they shrink when resized for the mobile layouts. Note that the tablet layout is kind of wonky - we don't have to follow the MarvelApp here exactly.

Scope

title: Grid on landing page
body:
On the landing page is a grid. We need to convert this to components and a layout in a Zeta DocDef. We want to have 1 component that can be customized to match the layout - either 1 row high or 2, with a background image URL, title, and optional subtext. The optional subtext can be seen on the We're Growing cell.

We need:

  • The custom component
  • A description of how to set up a DocDef to match the Marvel App

Scope

title: Create `wrapper` once header and footer are done
body: Once the header and footer are done, we can create a wrapper with them that can be selected as the template for a DocDef. The wrapper will add the header and footer and content will go between them.

title: Quotes carousel
body:
On the landing page, the second quote area has a carousel where multiple quotes are contained. We want to create a Quote Carousel component to handle this.

In the DocDef, a Quote Carousel will contain a bunch of Quote components inside of it, each one being customisable on the Document itself.

The carousel will change the quote at a configurable interval (customisable through a field), like every 10 seconds. The user will also be able to click the individual circles to navigate through the quotes. When the last quote is shown and the interval is up, it should go back to the first quote in the list.

title: Image cell component
body:
On the landing page, and most other pages, we have a top cell that's a background image with text over the top of it. This tends to have a couple minor layouts that we'll need to support through component configuration options.

The image URL and text should be configurable, and we need to make sure the desktop, tablet, and phone layouts are followed.

We also need to make it configurable with a back button, on certain pages.

I'm open to multiple components here if that makes sense.

Here are the examples we need to support:

Example 1

https://marvelapp.com/1b0ib23g/screen/50208826

Example 2

Example 3 (with back button)

Example 4

https://marvelapp.com/1b0ib23g/screen/50477564

title: Search components
body:
We have the ability now to build out the search components, similar to how we built out the Yelp components in a recent challenge.

Similar to the Yelp challenge, we want to split out the idea of the search panel from the results panel, having a few different components for different pages and options.

Service

Here's the service API description:

Job_Blaster_v2_API_-_Comcast.pdf

We want to target JSON format, and pagination that matches the storyboards in the Marvelapp.

Here's the Zeta developers guide: zeta-developers-guide.pdf

We need to figure out a reliable way of passing the parameters from the landing page to the results page. These pages will be separate DocDefs and Documents in Zeta.

  • Page 1 is the index - /
  • Page 2 will be the search results - /jobs/search

Mapping

In terms of field mapping for the results:

From the JSON in the service response for a specific job (https://jobblaster02.jwtbase.com/comcastapi/v1/job/177393-product-manager-content-origination-cloud-dvr-in-denver-co-technology-it/?format=json) to the UI:

  • apply_url --> Apply Now button
  • all_locations --> Location
  • contact --> Lead Recruiter
  • refnumber --> ReqID
  • industrycode --> Sub title under title, in black. Technology - Software Engineering, for example
  • job_description --> Stripped of HTML and used as the description text at the bottom of a result record
  • title --> Job title (in blue)

Drop downs

See here for the mapping. Anything TBD is out of scope for this challenge:

https://gitlab.com/hercules-jobs/project-resources-jobs/wikis/SearchMapping

Pages

  • https://marvelapp.com/1b0ib23g/screen/50208827
  • https://marvelapp.com/1b0ib23g/screen/50208826 (just the search panel under the top image)

We won't show the Details page quite yet - once we get the results done then we'll work on that.

Existing site

You can see the existing status of the conversion here:

http://ec2-54-81-101-21.compute-1.amazonaws.com:8000

DO NOT CHANGE ANYTHING ON THE SITE!

UI

title: Tabs in top panel
body:
On the top panel, a few pages have tabs inside the image panel. See By Location and By Team in the screenshot below.

We need to support this as a component we can add to the image panel, and then components we can add inside the tabs so that different contents are shown when a tab is selected.

title: Component for jobs by location
body:
NOTE this will require API calls through the search API built through this component: https://gitlab.com/hercules-jobs/project-resources-jobs/issues/14

We need to define the component that shows the jobs by location, seen for desktop on this page: https://marvelapp.com/1b0ib23g/screen/50208825

Please ensure to support desktop, tablet, and phone layouts.

The top tab (AF, GM, NS, TZ) will be country codes, like US or IN.

The panels will be the counts from the State values here:

https://jobblaster02.jwtbase.com/comcastapi/v1/jobsearch/?format=json&page=1&limit=1

We'll have to map the short state name to the long state name, like "MO" --> "Missouri", or "FL" --> "Florida".

Clicking a panel will go to the job search results screen.

Screenshot

title: Text components
body:
There are a couple text components scattered throughout the storyboard that we can add:

On the Brand page:

https://marvelapp.com/1b0ib23g/screen/50334777

Component 1

Component 2

We need to build these components, especially component 1, since that will be used in a lot of places in the site.

title: Quick links component
body: On https://marvelapp.com/1b0ib23g/screen/50487069, there's a list of Quick links above the footer. We need to build a component with this. The individual link cells should be configurable individually, both their text, and their URL to link to. Our People shows the mouseover state.

  • Check across all pages.

title: Video component
body:
On a few pages is a video component. This ticket will build the component.

https://marvelapp.com/1b0ib23g/screen/50487068

See the video - it has an overlay with the title, length, and a coloured bar underneath it. Underneath the video is the video description text. For now, assume a Youtube URL that pops up similar to what's seen here: https://jobs.comcast.com/diversity-and-inclusion/accessibility

The video description text will be long, so we should use a text area in the CMS for the input.

title: Categories list
body:
On this page, there are a couple new components at work: https://marvelapp.com/1b0ib23g/screen/50542664

Categories list

On the left is a list of categories. We want to treat these like tabs, so that when a category is clicked, it loads a new set of elements in the list on the left.

In the DocDef UI, we should be able to define the main list, and then individual categories that we can add cells to (see below)

Cells

Each cell in the list on the right has a default state and a clicked state.

We want to be able to configure:

  • The image on the left
  • The default cell text shown (not selected)
  • The video or image URL shown when selected
  • The title shown when selected, like "Innovation in Technology & Entertainment"
  • The text shown when selected, like "With Xfinity, Comcast delivers..."
  • The link URL shown when selected
  • The text for the link shown when selected ("Read more about Xfinity")

title: Search box bug
body:
@obog - Can you look at this one please?

The search box has been added back in (#12). The problem we are seeing is that the implementation doesn't work real well from sub-directories from the root of the website.

For instance, if you navigate to:

https://aegis-elearning.comcast.com/search/node/test, and then use the upper-right hand corner search box to search for test, the URL gets created as:

https://aegis-elearning.comcast.com/search/node/search/node/test which is incorrectly a search for search/node/test, instead of just test. The same applies if you try to search from Training Calendar, because that URL is https://aegis-elearning.comcast.com/event-created/month

If you try to search for test on that page, the new URL gets created as https://aegis-elearning.comcast.com/event-created/search/node/test which doesn't work.

title: Direct user to requested page when SSO is invoked
body:
Description

In #76 the customer has requested the ability to provide a user-friendly link to users to be able to interact directly with content on the site.

Currently, they are reporting that if a user does select a specific site link (not the homepage) and is NOT logged in (SSO) already and is prompted to login, they are being redirected to the home page after authorization.

The intent of this ticket is to ensure that in the above scenario, the user is routed to the appropriate "deep" link post SSO authorization.

Acceptance Tests

Non-SSO user.

  1. User selects a "deep" link for P2 (e.g. #76 )
  2. User is prompted to sign in to authenticate themselves.
  3. System authenticates and authorizes the user.
  4. User is directed to the "deep" link page, NOT the home page.

If the user clicks the "X" (https://marvelapp.com/ff494d9/screen/51053309), the filter will be cleared, and the top numbers will go back to their default.

title: Clicking comment buttons open Comment Viewer app even if BitBucket credentials are wrong
body:
When you click on one of comment buttons (red/blue icon), it opens the BitBucket login form firstly, if you're not logged in. If you don't input correct credentials on the login form, login will fail but Comment Viewer app will be opened.

Steps to Reproduce

Make sure you're not logged in to BitBucket, so buttons will open the login form firstly. You can stop debugging and start again to achieve this.

  1. Go to GitLens tab from left side
  2. Click on Search icon to open up the Commit Search window
  3. Select one or several commit(s)
  4. Click on a file from the right side, to open the diff window
  5. Click on any comment button (red or blue icon), to open the BitBucket Login Form
  6. Supply wrong credentials and submit

Actual Result

Since you've supplied wrong credentials, login will fail. But Comment Viewer app will be opened.

Expected Result

If credentials are wrong, comment viewer app should not be opened.

Video Screencast

title: Commit Search treats keywords case-sensitive
body:
Commit Search should work case-insensitive

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Go to the GitLens tab from the left side
  2. Click on the Search icon (right to the Explorer title), to open the Commit Search view
  3. From your commit list, choose a word contains both upper and lower case letters. Write that keyword in the "enter search text" area, as it is. E.g. If you have commits with "Merge pull request..." You can enter "Merge"
  4. Click Search button, Observe.
  5. Write the same keyword with lowercase letters, in the "enter search text". E.g. write "merge" instead of "Merge"
  6. Click Search button, Observe

Actual Results

Search functionality works case-sensitive and doesn't return results if you don't search the keyword as it is.

Expected Results

Search functionality should work case-insensitive and should return results in both cases.

Video Screencast

title: Add "Search by Commit Hash" functionality in Commit Search
body:
There is currently no way for searching by commit hash. Entering the hash value in "enter search text" area doesn't work. So there should be a way to do this.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Go to the GitLens tab from the left side
  2. Click on the Search icon (right to the Explorer title), to open the Commit Search view
  3. Observe. There is no way to search by commit hash.
  4. Try to entering a commit hash in "enter search text" area. Observe, it doesn't work.

Actual Results

There is currently no way to search commits by hash.

Expected Results

This should be added

title: Add mention functionality to Comment Editor app
body:
Comment Editor app currently doesn't have the mention capability that BitBucket is providing

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Go to the GitLens tab from the left side
  2. Click on the Search icon (right to the Explorer title), to open the Commit Search view
  3. Select one or several commit(s)
  4. Click on a file from right side
  5. Click on the red or blue button
  6. Login to BitBucket if necessary
  7. Click Add Comment
  8. Try to mention someone in your comment (e.g. write "@cagdas001")
  9. Observe, it doesn't show any mention suggestion
  10. Go to bitbucket.org
  11. Open your repo and go to the Commits
  12. Select one commit
  13. Add a comment
  14. Try to mention someone as in the 7th step.
  15. Observe, it shows mention suggestions

Actual Results

Comment Editor app doesn't have any action to mention someone

Expected Results

Comment Editor app should have a action to mention some. The preferred way is same as BitBucket

Screenshots

Comment Editor BitBucket

title: Deactivate Product Problem
body:
• I want to ensure that we can deactivate a product without messing up the the reservations - We want to be able to stop future reservations/scheduling for a particular product but not lose past data?
  • I think as long as when we call on a past schedule using a inactive product doesn't break the system we should be good. And then yes keep the data - no delete
  • A reservation shouldn't become inactive - just the product. I think this affects the scheduler more than anything.
  • So for example a product should only be allowed to be marked as inactive when: ** No future reservations are chosen for that product ** No future instructor schedule items are tied to that product
  • But the product should be visible to look at past data
  • Example: in the year 2017 there was a special training product made and in 2018 it was no longer available. The user sets the product to inactive, so that it does not appear on the scheduler to assign. But they still want to look at the schedule from 2017 to see who worked that product.
  • Only on the product page to reactivate.

title: Previously active window doesn't regain focus after hiding the Comment Editor
body:
This had discussed before: https://github.com/billsedison/vscode-gitlens/issues/72

I think we should keep this open as an known issue, until it's fixed. I had no time to open an issue for this but will do in a few days.

Since it's found before the Bug Hunt, I think this should not be counted

Describe the bug

After hiding the electron app, the previously active window doesn't get the focus.

Platform:

  • OS: macOS High Sierra 10.13.6

To Reproduce

Make sure External App: Keep Open parameter checked in GitLens Settings, otherwise comment app quits directly instead of hiding

  1. Go to GitLens tab from the left side
  2. Click on the Search icon (right to the Explorer title), to open the Commit Search view
  3. Select one or several commit(s)
  4. On the right side, select and open a file.
  5. Place the cursor on a line has comment(s).
  6. Click the blue icon at the top, to show the inline comments.
  7. Click one of the Add Comment, Reply or Edit buttons to show the BitBucket Comment App.
  8. Now click on Cancel to hide the app.

Actual Results

The last active window (probably comment viewer), doesn't get the focus. You should click once on that window to give focus again.

Expected Results

The previously active window should regain focus when the electron app hidden.

Video Screencast

https://youtu.be/S_pe_9A_K8g

title: Data Input Create Division - Sub-Division Reset
body:
• On the Data Input Screen…
  • On the Create New Division or Sub-Division tab…
  • Select Parent Division - Select “LD”
  • Region Auto-populates with “EPG” (which is correct)
  • Sub-Division ID – Enter “9.78”
  • Sub-Division Name – Enter “Dedy” THEN
  • Press the Reset button. All fields should reset. You will see that the Region field does not currently reset. It stays set at EPG.

title: Data Input Create Division or Sub-Division with No Region
body:
• On the Data Input Screen…
  • On the Create New Division or Sub-Division tab…
  • The Canada Parent Division has no Region associated to it. This is true at Eaton.
  • However, the Region field is a required/mandatory field on this screen. So, we must have an option to choose.
  • So, can you add a “Canada” option to this Region drop down list? This will allow us to select Canada as the Parent Division name and then have an option to choose for the Region (which also happens to be Canada in this case).
  • NOTE!!! – This new “Canada” region option will also have to be added to the Region field on the “Create New C&S Issue” tab on the Data Input page AND the Region drop down filter on the C&S Issues page AND the Region drop down field in the “Edit Division” modal window that pops up when editing entries in the “Data Management” screen.

title: Edit C&S Issue Creator Name
body:
• On the C&S Issues page, you notice that all of the data in the “Created By” column is the same.
  • Every entry currently says admin in this column.
  • Can you give a person who is logged in as Admin the ability to edit this field? i.e. if I click on the edit pen icon, I want to be able to edit the Creator Name, so I can get all these names correct.
  • Only an Admin can edit this field.
  • Currently, this is not a piece of data that can be edited.

title: C&S Issue Edit Role
body:
The way we requested the C&S Issues page to function is like this:

  • 1.) A person logged in as Admin can view all entries, view all details, edit any entry (via pen), and delete any entry (via trash can).
  • 2.) A person logged in as DataManager can only view, edit and delete the entries that they have created. DataManagers cannot view or change entries that they did not create. Currently all DataManagers can see all entries. Can this be fixed?
  • EXAMPLE: Person A creates 2 new C&S issues. Person B creates 1 new C&S Issue. Both of these people are DataManager user type. Person A cannot see Person B’s entries, and Person B cannot see Person A’s entries. They can only view, edit, and/or delete their own entries. An Admin can view, edit, or delete all entries. Can you set permissions so that the created by person can only see their own entries?
  • If so, once I have the admin ability to edit all the created by names, then the functionality will work as we want it.
  • 3.) A person not logged in (StandardUser) cannot even get to the C&S Issues page. This part is working fine. No issue.

  4. Check that it is not getting added

  2. This function works if you press the "Add New Location" Button or "Add New Category" button and then fill the form and save the changes.

title: Proof of concept for notifications in Cordova
body:
@seriyvolk83 - This one's an existing hybrid app that we may be doing some work on.

The client has this request regarding notifications:

Lastly, we need to let the Comcast team know if there is a method to receive a push notification in cordova but not show a system device tray notification. The want to be able to use a push notification system (i believe they said Azure notification?) to notify the app that there is a new message, and just show the red unread dot on the notification bell (edited)

This is similar to how Slack works, I think. It can show that there are unread messages, but it doesn't actually pop up an alert.

Can you work up a simple PoC (in Cordova) to show this please?

https://medium.com/@felipepucinelli/how-to-add-push-notifications-in-your-cordova-application-using-firebase-69fac067e821

This can be a new Cordova app - it doesn't have to be this existing application.

title: Add the ability to filter and mutiselect commits **Inside** the explorer view
body:
Client wants to add the ability to filter and multi-select commits inside the explorer view (left side, bring by the original GitLens extension).

Here are our requirements.

(1) We are able to select multiple commits in the explorer view on the left side, the multi-selection result will reflect to the right panel accordingly (the search view we built)

(2) When we filter commits on the right side, the commits on the left panel will be filtered accordingly.

I'm not sure if it's possible to select multiple commits in the explorer view, if it's impossible, we can find an alternative solution.

Get an alternative workaround from the client

The alternative is to make our search View on the right have a similar tree view on the inner left subpanel.

We can narrow the gitlens explorer panel to increase screen real estate for the search view (our new custom view). Inside the search view we can change the format of the left subpanel to look like the explorer panel yet be able to filter the entries, and multi-click the entries to build the agg diff view on the right subpanel. We would be able to easily see the changed files per commit in the left subpanel (same as the explorer view) and compare to the agg-diff listing in the right panel.

title: Component updates
body:
This was feedback from the client regarding a review of our Zeta implementation so far. We should look at other Comcast components to ensure we're in line with what they do elsewhere.

Component CSS and JavaScript should not be included in component files. They can live within the component directories, but they should be compiled into resources files that are added at the wrapper level.

When doing this, there should be 2 sets of CSS & JS files created:

  • Theme files – a CSS & JavaScript file that includes all of the styles and functionalities for the wrapper
  • Component files – a CSS & JavaScript file that includes all of the styles and functionalities for the components (this allows the components to be used in other projects with other wrappers without conflict of wrapper styles)

title: Convert job details page
body:
This ticket will comprise two parts:

Convert

We need to convert the page here:

https://marvelapp.com/1c078j1g/screen/51695103

into Zeta at http://54.83.37.71:8000/jobs/description

Figure out how to load a job detail

The data on this page will be dynamic, loaded from JWT, at a URL like this:

https://jobblaster02.jwtbase.com/comcastapi/v1/job/177393-product-manager-content-origination-cloud-dvr-in-denver-co-technology-it/?format=json

What we have to do is:

  • Accept a URL parameter for the job URL for JWT, like above
  • Map the content from JWT to the layout
    • Eng 2, Engineering --> title field from JWT
    • Technology - Software Engineering --> industrycode field from JWT

title: Searching by Commit Hash may return wrong result
body:
Describe the bug

Search by commit hash functionality in the Commit Search view may return wrong results.

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

  1. Clone the test repo from BitBucket.
  2. git clone https://bitbucket.org/billsedison/gitlens-test.git
  3. Open the test repo folder in VSCode with Open Folder
  4. Go to the Commit Search view
  5. In the enter commit hash field, type 28be468 and click Search
  6. It will return the wrong commit. Find the information for commit 28be468 in screenshots

Expected behavior

Searching by commit hash should return the exact match of given hash

Screenshots

Additional context

Current implementation combines all parameters including commit hash, and, if hash value is specified, sets maxCount to 1 so returns only one result/commit.

This may return wrong commit even if you would search by commit hash.

PR: https://github.com/billsedison/vscode-gitlens/pull/114

This PR fixes this, searching by commit hash will return exact match.

I have not made any change in the service and done this on the top level (web UI), not to affect future implementations.

title: Auto-Create Events
body:
The task here is to auto-create new events. I believe this means a Heroku worker.js and clock.js need to be created, but I'm open to suggestion.

The thought here is we have weekly bar events (RecurringEvent) and we want to auto-populate the calendar with those events (Event)without having to do so manually.

Every Saturday Night at Midnight EST, a service should:

  1. GET /recurring-events?isActive=1&isAutoGenerate=1
  2. Loop through the RecurringEvent results and make sure there are 4 weeks worth of Events created
  3. If an event doesn't exist, create one mapping the info from the RecurringEvent to the Event

Example

Today's date is January 5th 2019. There are two recurring weekly events, one at Bar A on Tuesdays, one at Bar B on Wednesdays.

  1. Bar A already has events in the database for 1/8, 1/15, 1/22. The system should create 1/29
  2. Bar B has no events in database. The system should create 1/9, 1/16, 1/23, 1/30

You will provide

  • [x] The code to satisfy above
  • [x] Config settings for how many weeks to create
    • Default to 4 weeks
    • Able to set via Heroku Config Var
  • [ ] Configuration and deployment details in the README, including how to run the code locally (ie: not on heroku)

title: Update map component for real job counts
body:
The map component on http://54.83.37.71:8000/jobs/by-location needs to be updated to show accurate job counts.

From the client:

The aggregate numbers are available in the facets section of the response to the standard job search endpoint.

Example: https://jobblaster02.jwtbase.com/comcastapi/v1/jobsearch/?format=json&limit=5&page=2

Facets contains data on categories, city, company, country, job_status, requisition_type, state and teams

Looking at teams, its a list of results which are state ID and job count in the state. It looks to be returned into states with most jobs first.

to keep us moving, I went ahead and mapped all of the city’s to states. I’m sure this is brittle but lets use this for now

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1UXJFyOF1luzYf3m25S24HTDcj7BLWPI-oCi2X7WKrVk/edit?usp=sharing

title: Home Page - Search should redirect to JIBE
body:
On the home page, the user has the ability to search - by keyword and/or by location.

When the user hits Go or <return>, the results will not be shown on jobs.comcast.com but on JIBE.

The keyword and location are set in the JIBE search URL in the following fashion:

https://comcast.jibeapply.com/jobs?page=1&keywords=<KEYWORD>&location=<LOCATION>

For example, a search with keyword of "test" and location of "boston" should create the following URL:

https://comcast.jibeapply.com/jobs?page=1&keywords=test&location=boston

title: Map tweaks
body:
A couple tweaks are needed to the by-location page:

States that have 0 count should be grey

For states that have a 0 count, we're going to make those grey, and for states with a count greater than 0, those will be blue, with the yellow hover-state. See below for an examples of two states that should be grey:

Clicking a state

Right now, clicking a state will just highlight it, but we need to move to the search on the JIBE site.

When a state is clicked, send the user to: https://comcast.jibeapply.com/jobs?location={state name}&page=1

Like: https://comcast.jibeapply.com/jobs?location=michigan&page=1

Or: https://comcast.jibeapply.com/jobs?location=pennsylvania&page=1

title: Further map tweaks
body:
More map tweaks are needed:

Drop down

  1. The drop down for the states must match the data. Note that there are 50 states we need to handle.

  2. If a state has 0 jobs, hide it from the drop down.

State mouseover

We need to ensure that all 50 states properly support mouseover states if they have jobs. Please ensure that all 50 states are covered properly.

We can add HI and AK for Hawaii and Alaska to the buttons on the right for the smaller states, without showing them on the map.

title: Figure out backup deploy
body:
@dhruvit_r - Attached is a DB backup from the client that we'd like to be able to deploy and modify in Zeta. I've been messing with this the last few days and haven't been able to successfully deploy changes locally.

What I've done:

  • Modified the config for web to use campus-web-data
  • Modified the config for cms to use campus-cms
  • Restored the DB via mongorestore dump --drop
  • Deleted the contents of campus-cms/securities and campus-web-data/securities
  • Created a new env
  • Published the docs to the new env

Then, when I try to modify a document, like /Philadelphia, I can do that, but the changes aren't reflected in the campus-web-data DB.

Can you take a look please? Not sure where I'm screwing this up, thanks!

title: Update the Zeta instance with new UI
body:
Description

The client has an existing Cordova app that uses Cordova and Zeta to provide content.

This ticket will track updating some of the components and general content to match new prototype screens.

For this ticket, we will have the campus app home screen in scope (03-Comcast-Campus-App-Home in the prototype).

What we need to do is update the current Comcast Center doc def to match the new prototype

This will involve:

  • Component updates (See link below)
  • Adding some new content and exposing it via fields on the doc def for the description
  • Loading in any additional images necessary

Target URL

http://54.227.247.244:8000/philadelphia/comcast-center

Current app screen

New app screen

App signin

In the Cordova app, sign in with csp-test-user / C0mcastDev!

Note

It seems like the first time the app loads in the iOS simulator, the main page is cached. If you click the pin icon in the upper right and then the first cell, it should load from our server instead of the cache, showing any changes.

For the image, just use what's currently available. Don't worry about matching the prototype exactly.

Links

  • Zeta components: https://gitlab.com/hercules-campus/project-resources-campus
  • Prototype from the client: http://excelliscorp.com/sandbox/Campus-App-UI-Specs/index.html
    • Username: excellis
    • Password: sandbox
  • Dev assets:
  • CMS: http://54.227.247.244:8010/#/dashboard
  • Site: http://54.227.247.244:8000/
  • Cordova app: https://gitlab.com/hercules-campus/campus-app
  • Details on existing DB backup for local deployment: https://gitlab.com/hercules-campus/campus-app/issues/3

title: Products Page - Base Schedule section - Dates are dublicated and not deleted
body:
Case 1:

  1. Log in as Admin user
  2. Go to Products page
  3. Select any product from the dropdown
  4. In Base Schedule section - select Scheduling Pattern (Monthly or Specific)
  5. Add the Day

  1. Click the button Save Changes
  2. After changes were saved, select the same product and edit any field, then save the changes again

Actual: Days are dublicated every time you save the changes

Expected: Data should not be dublicated

Case 2:

  1. Click on delete icon, delete the days (all or at least one)
  2. Save the changes
  3. After changes were saved, select the same product

Actual: days are not deleted
Expected: days should be deleted when save the changes

title: Training Calendar creating a recurring email events/invite.
body:
Current calendar is difficult to manage – from entering duplicate entries, to how the text CSS shows up, it makes it difficult for users to follow and add .ICS file from sign ups to their Outlook calendars. Admins have asked to simply this.

As an admin, I’d like to be able to manage entering duplicate entries quickly, with one invite, vs copy and pasting invites 20 times in one month (P2elearning@comcast.com)

Requirements

  • Explore feasibility Integrating with Outlook, to allow for adding repeating calendar entries

Rally

Rally Link

Related Rally User Story https://rally1.rallydev.com/#/269788904756d/detail/userstory/271993050364

title: Update click flows with items that have third level pages
body:
In the header, there are three different areas where the navigation goes three levels; there is first level (i.e. Programs), second level (i.e. University Relations) and third level (i.e. Graduate Programs).

There are three second level items that have subpages (level three):

  • Programs > University Relations
  • Programs > Military
  • Life at Comcast > Diversity & Inclusion

The issue with the current implementation is that all three of these second level pages are pages themselves. And these pages are not accessible from header in current form.

Below is the desired behavior

Desired Behavior

The following is the desired behavior.

  1. User selects Programs or Life at Comcast and then one of the second level options with children
  2. The subpages panel is displayed; the browser does not navigate to another page
  3. If the user selects the text for the parent link (University Relations or Military, the user will now be navigated to those pages:
    • University Relations : /university-relations
    • Military : /programs/military
    • Diversity & Inclusion: /life-at-comcast/diversity-inclusion
  4. The user will only traverse back up a level in the header nav if they hit the back arrow.

title: Accessibility - About Us > Business Structure page - fix tab order
body:
For accessibility, the page links need to be navigatable via the Tab button. On the Business Structure page (/about-us/business-structure), the tab order skips the main content of the page.

The tab correctly traverses the header links, left to right, but after "Search Jobs", the focus jumps to "Check our FAQs..." link at the bottom of the page.

The correct flow would be that after Search Jobs, the cursor would travel (in order) to:

  • All Brands link under Categories
  • Go down the links in the Categories, top to bottom
  • After TPX, the focus would jump to the Comcast Business section and then go down the three other middle sections
  • After Comcast Technology Solutions, the focus would then jump to FAQs.

See image below

title: Update landing page docdef
body:
We need to update the landing page doc def with these changes:

  1. Add a media field for the Create the future with us image, allowing this to be easily changed.
  2. Add a field for the Why Comcast content. Both the Why Comcast title, and the paragraph underneath it should be editable on the document.
  3. Add a field for the quote information in the first quote section
  4. Add a list field for the cells under the first quote - We're Growing, Military & Veteran Commitment, etc...
  5. Add a list field for the quotes in the carousel under the cells.
  6. Add a list field for the latest stories

The goal is to have a majority of the content on the page easily editable.

title: Update History doc def
body:
Page affected

http://54.83.37.71:8000/about-us/history

Fields that need to be editable on the document

  • Top banner image
  • Page title and sub title (About Us, and History over top banner image)
  • The Beginning title and paragraph text
  • 1963 video URL and all text
  • All cells underneath each individual decade grouping - 1970s, 1980s, 1990s. This should be done as a list on the doc def so that users can add, move, and rearrange video cells as needed.

title: In MacOS Mojave, only mac address of the Remote App is displayed instead of Device name while pairing
body:
In MacOS Mojave, only mac address of the Remote App is displayed instead of Device name while pairing. Tested Android 8(Galaxy S7).

Steps:

  1. In phone settings, turn Bluetooth to "off".
  2. Launch Android Remote App, which will enable bluetooth in phone.
  3. In Mac, enable bluetooth and search for the Mobile name to be seen in scan results.

Actual Result: Phone name is not seen. Only mac address of the app is seen. Also after selecting "connect" in Mac, another pop-up comes up again with "phone name" to connect.

title: Deployment documentation for dev
body:
@dhruvit_r - I'm concerned about running further challenges here as the deployment environment seems a little murky to set up, and I think competitors might skip it due to that.

What I'd like to do is get ahead on the documentation:

  1. We need a markdown doc that describes how to:
  • Get a trial Rally account
  • Get a Bitbucket account set up
  • Get Jenkins running locally (will be used for the next challenge) on a simple build of a test app
  1. I'd also like to get a vagrant or docker setup that includes any necessary local dependencies for Node, Jenkins, and anything else needed. We can talk through this if necessary. If the steps above are reasonable, we may skip this, but I want to make sure we have a "click and deploy" environment available for members to be able to participate in the next challenge(s), thanks!

title: Training Main Page Content Hierarchy
body:
Description

This ticket will track redesigning the Training page to show a content heirarchy.

On the main Training page, we will consolidate the content into groups based on their categories (kind of like document folders)

These categories currently are Website tags with content in them. The goal of this is to group the tags on the main page (when users click on "Training" from the menu

Landing on this page will show 3 columns of categories, with the tags distributed between them. The tags are found in /admin/structure/taxonomy/document_tags.

Col 1 Col 2 Col 3
Intro Communication Pre-Job
Working a Job Job Logistics Estimating Work
Invoices Surveys & Permits As Built
Residential Reporting Release Updates
Recorded Sessions Documents Quiz

Clicking on one of these cells would behave the same as if filtering by Tag; opening a grid of the content that matches the selected tag, in the same layout as what is currently on the /training page.

NOTE This layout will be above the current drop downs on the /training page. This will just be another way for the user to select a specific tag, the same as using the Tag drop down.

Rally (Can be ignored for this challenge)

[Rally Link](https://rally1.rallydev.com/#/269788904756d/detail/userstory/272011968860

https://software.topcoder.com/review/actions/ViewProjectDetails?pid=30077383

title: Fix Plan Event Status - Backend
body:
Logic for Plan Event Queue Status is the following:

a) Go – Effective date greater than or equal to current date, event has been assigned, all additional required data elements in detail tab have been entered.

b) Caution – Effective date greater than current date, event has been assigned, waiting on additional required data elements to be entered in detail tab

c) Stop – Effective date greater than or equal to current date and event has not been assigned

d) Stop – Effective date equal to current date, event has been assigned, waiting on additional required data elements to be entered in detail tab

e) Stop – One or more workflows associated with Plan Event are past due

f) Completed - All Workflows associated with a Plan Event are completed

title: Workflow Dashboard is showing wrong past due status
body: Workflow Dashboard is showing a Workflow as Past Due with a Status of Go. Status should be Stop

title: Fix Workflow dashboard count
body:
The status in dashboard screen for pending, past due and completed for Workflow only must be:

  1. Pending: Count of number of Workflow records where due date is equal to current date and workflow is NOT completed

  2. Past Due: Count of number of Workflow records where due date is less than current date and workflow is NOT completed

  3. Completed: Count of number of Workflow records where due date is equal to current date or greater than current date - 8 days and workflow is completed.

title: DocDef export script
body:
@dhruvit_r - If you have time after the campus tickets and can take a look at this one, I'd appreciate it.

We're going to be exporting data from our dev site for the client. What I'd like to be able to do is provide them with all the docdefs as .docdef files, in the same format as if we had:

  • Gone into the UI for each docdef
  • Clicked Export docdef
  • Collected all the files

:point_up: Would be time consuming, so I'm hoping we can build a Node script that does the export for all docdefs, in the same format as the app, and makes them available in a compressed file like a zip or tar.gz.

Based on what I can tell, the export is just the docdef data from Mongo, without an explicit _id field set. We'll need to test an import to make sure that we can import it correctly.

title: Plan Event Dashboard totals do not add up.
body:
Example: All = 16; Pending = 15; Past Due = 1; Completed = 1. Would expect All to = 17.

Try deleting items from workflow/plan event queue to see if count is being messed up

The status for pending, past due and completed for Plan Event only is:

  1. Pending: Count of number of Plan Events where effective date is equal to current date and NOT all workflows associated are completed

  2. Past Due: Count of number of Plan Events where effective date is less than current date and NOT all workflows associated are completed

  3. Completed: Count of number of Plan Events where effective date is equal to current date or greater than current date - 8 days, and all workflows associated are completed.

title: Roll up of multiple plan events
body:
Background: Workflow should rollup multiple plan events with same effective date, CUSIP and account number, and same transaction type.

  • When creating a new plan event, the backend should search for existing plan event with the following criteria:

    1. Same effective date.

    2. Same CUSIP.

    3. Same account number.

    4. Transaction type is one of [Trade, Trade Purchase, Trade Redemption, Trade Cross Class Exchange] and is the same as the transaction type that is being created.

  • If the criteria is met, the workflows of type Trade Notification should be fetch. If only one record is returned and workflow.parentId is null, backend should:

    1. Create a new workflow with workflow type Trade Notification. Assigned To will be set to null and plan event will be set to the plan event being created.

    2. Update parentId property in then existing workflow with the id of the workflow created in step no. 1.

    3. For the workflow being created with type Trade Notification for the new plan event, the id of the workflow created in step no. 1 should be set to the parentId property.

  • If the criteria is met and more than one record is returned and one of the record has workflow.parentId null and all others records have workflow.parentId not null, backend should:

    1. For the workflow being created with type Trade Notification for the new plan event, the id of the workflow that has workflow.parentId null should be set to the parentId property.

title: Auto-scrolling feature in the Comment Viewer app. scrolls to bottom when adding and deleting reply
body:
Describe the bug Auto-scroll feature in the Comment Viewer app. scrolls to bottom of the page when a new comment added. Newly added comments are already shown at bottom of the page, so this is OK. But it also scrolls to bottom when adding or deleting reply. Replies can be somewhere above too, instead of bottom of page.

To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:

  1. Go to any file and click Blue icon.
  2. Login to BitBucket if necessary
  3. Add some comments, so page will expand to bottom and scrollbar will be enabled.
  4. Scroll to the top.
  5. Add a reply to one of comments at top
  6. Scroll to the top, delete a reply from one of comments at top.

Expected behavior

  • Auto-scrolling feature should scroll to the bottom of page when ONLY a new comment (not reply) added. It should not scroll when deleted.
  • When a new reply (not comment) added, it should detect its parent and scroll to it, rather than bottom of page.

Actual behavior

  • It scrolls to the bottom of page when when a reply deleted.
  • When a new reply (not comment) added, it scrolls to the bottom of page.

Screencast

title: 2nd and deeper level replies (reply-to-reply) don't get deleted in the Comment Viewer
body:
Describe the bug Deep level (from 2nd) replies (reply-to-reply) don't get deleted in the Comment Viewer app. It successfuly deletes the comment, but doesn't reflect the result in the app. Needs to be re-opened to see the comment has been deleted.

To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:

  1. Go to any file and click the Blue icon.
  2. Login to BitBucket if necessary
  3. Add some deep-level replies
  4. Try to delete 2nd or deeper level replies

Expected behavior The result should be properly reflected in the app, so that user will be able to see comment has been deleted.

Actual Behavior 2nd and deeper level replies don't get deleted in the app

Screencast

title: Infinite saving
body:
Sometimes I created a task and added discussion, then press save, the saving process is always hanging, can't exit unless I re-run the extension.

You should set a maximal timeout (Like 20 seconds, should be configurable) for the saving process. If the saving process is not completed, then you should terminate it and prompt an error dialog to hint the user.

title: Order in the questions portion
body:
Need to change order in the questions portion, the last 2 questions should be first, they immediately start to change the graphics by answering these.

To do we need to introduce questions map and apply it to sort all questions loaded. Add a constant to the app config such that defines the order of the questions. Use question's calcRef property as map key and set its order as an integer number from 1-n. Then when questions are fetched re-order them according to the map.

Questions data is here -> https://gitlab.com/asod-calculator/api/tree/dev/data In the end questions order should match like https://drive.google.com/file/d/1u2BSPZLY5AmDf_kenqtJONoO0_HekTF1/view?usp=sharing

title: Updated setup for bitbucket.org
body:
From the client, this is the expected flow and setup. We need to:

  • Tweak our script and validation documentation to support the flow below
  • Update the video to show the flow below
Here is the process for Bitbucket Cloud (v2 api with no Bitbucket-Rally plugin:
1. commit, push, create PR
2. Jenkins triggers on new PR created
  i. locally fetch and merge PR with HEAD of `master`
  ii. build/test/validate
  iii. on success:
     a. mark PR as approved by Jenkins
     b. add a build link to PR to show the build that approved the PR.
     c. post the update PR dev back to Bitbucket api v2
     d. post to *merge* the PR using Bitbucket api v2
     d. use Rally WSAPI to post the changeset with link to Bitbucket changeset (same as Bitbucket-Rally connector plugin) *and* the build job link.
 iv. on *fail*
     a. mark PR as unnapproved by Jenkins
     b. add a build link to the PR to show the build that declined the PR
     c. post the updated PR def back to Bitbucket api v2
     d. post to *decline* the PR using Bitbucket api v2
     e. since no changeset was merged there is no changeset sent to Rally, nothing to update there. (edited)

title: Getting Email with ICS File & Timezone
body:
As a user, when I sign up for an event - I’d like an email with an .ICS file, which I can add to outlook.

As an admin, I’d like to be able to manage entering duplicate entries quickly, with one invite, vs copy and pasting invites 20 times in one month (P2elearning@comcast.com)

title: Refine the deletion process of tasks and discussion
body:
From the review

For the task deletion, as per the spec, By pressing the button for deletion, a confirmation window should be prompted for the double confirmation.

https://monosnap.com/file/wD3SuSDCwhIWyzPSW4tDAhUS2xAfNx

But you just marked it as deletion. The task is deleted only when pressing "Save", that's not intuitive.

  1. Task deletion

When pressing the delete button, you should prompt a confirmation window for the double confirmation. If the user clicked "Yes", then remove the task tab directly, instead of marked it as deleted.

If the user didn't save but pressed sync, then restore the deleted task tab.

  1. Discussion deletion

In a similar way as deleting tasks, prompt a confirmation window should be prompted for the double confirmation. If the user clicked "Yes", then remove the task tab directly, instead of marked it as deleted.

If the user didn't save but pressed sync, then restore the deleted discussion.

title: Implement notifications
body:
Using the headless CMS features (wiki link TBD), we want to implement the notifications in the header. See 02-Comcast-Campus-App-Home (http://excelliscorp.com/sandbox/Campus-App-UI-Specs/index.html#artboard3) in the storyboard, and the bell with red circle in the header.

The notifications will be displayed as they are in 03-01-Comcast-Camus-App-Notifications.

Zeta details

Notifications are simply documents from Zeta, pulled through headless CMS (wiki link TBD)

  • We'll use a single Doc Def for Notifications with a repeater (like Navigation under the Location info Doc Def - zeta:form-datalist with a Subject, Rich-text body, start date, and end date
  • App pulls those repeated docs, subject to start date and end date
  • User can “mark as read” and “delete” the notifications.
    • mark as read removes the unread flag
    • delete hides the notification from view on the app side only.
    • No data is sent back to the server - we have to do this purely in app storage.

title: Handle all errors gracefully to avoid the script crashing
body:
From the client

I'm getting this error when I try to run the bitbucket script:

21:01 $ node bin/index.js search
{"message":"Scanning repository \"tmo_config\"","level":"info"}
{"message":"Initial scan for repository. Scanning all files","level":"info"}
{"message":"Scanning branch remotes/origin/Atul_Metro_Apache2.4_AEM6.4.1","level":"info"}

{"message":"Scanning branch remotes/origin/feature/ci_cd_pipelines","level":"info"}
{"message":"Scanning branch remotes/origin/feature/disaster_recovery","level":"info"}
{"message":"Scanning branch remotes/origin/master","level":"info"}{"message":"Scanning open pull requests for repository \"tmo_config\"","level":"info"}
(node:9923) UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: HTTPError
    at getData.then.error (/Users/rharrin15/Downloads/bitbucket-unauth/node_modules/bitbucket/src/request/fetch.js:53:17)
    at process.internalTickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:77:7)
(node:9923) UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: Unhandled promise rejection. This error originated either by throwing inside of an async function without a catch block, or by rejecting a promise which was not handled with .catch(). (rejection id: 1)
(node:9923) [DEP0018] DeprecationWarning: Unhandled promise rejections are deprecated. In the future, promise rejections that are not handled will terminate the Node.js process with a non-zero exit code.

I commented out this call:

`/* await searchPullRequests(repositoryUrl) */`

and it runs all the way through.

Could be a permission issue... I think this is the code that fails:

  ```if (response.status >= 400 || [304].includes(response.status)) {
    return getData(response).then(error => {
      throw new HTTPError(error, response.status, responseHeaders)
    })
  }```
