title: Period support for GET /reports
body:
We need time period support added to the GET /reports api. Therefore:

  1. Add support for: from and to optional query fields. When those are present(both of them, no open periods) in request then the results should be filtered on createdBy field of report's record. Use standarized utc dates for from and to.
  2. API should check the createdBy field. If user is admin then show all reports. If user is standart user then only those created by him/her.
  3. Update swagger spec with lates changes.

@all ^^^

title: New endpoint for reports
body:
We need summery on reports. Therefore we need to create new endpoint in Reports:

  1. GET /reports/summary - it should deliver:
  • all reports count
  • incomplete count
  • complete count
  • downloaded count
  1. API should check the createdBy field and filter results based on logged user. If user is admin then show all reports. If user is standart user then only those created by him/her.
  2. Update swagger spec with lates changes.

@all ^^^

title: Updated setup for bitbucket data server
body:
From the client, this is the expected flow and setup. We need to:

  • Update the local setup to include Bitbucket Data Server and the rally connector plugin (https://gitlab.com/bitbucket-rally-extension/bitbucket-rally-connector)
  • Tweak our script and validation documentation to support the flow below
  • Update the video to show the flow below

Here is the process for Bitbucket Data Server (with Bitbucket-Rally Connector plugin by TC):

1. commit, push, create PR
2. Jenkins triggers on new PR created -
  i. locally fetch and merge PR with HEAD of `master`
  ii. build/test/validate
  iii. on success Jenkins will:
      a. mark the PR as approved by Jenkins
      b. add a build link to the PR to show the build that approved the PR
      c. post the updated PR def back to Bitbucket v1 api
      b. post to bitbucket API to *merge* the PR,
      d. use Rally WSAPI to get the listed artifact changeset list (the changeset will already be created by our Bitbucket Data Server plugin)
          i. update the changeset with the successful build link and post back to Rally.
  II. On Fail, Jenkins will:
     a.  mark the PR as unapproved by Jenkins
     b. add a build link to the PR to show the build that approved the PR
     c. post the updated PR def back to Bitbucket v1 api
     d. post to Bitbucket v1 api to *decline* the PR
     e. Since the PR has not been merged there is not changeset to mark. (edited)

title: Generate PoC / setup documentation for Cognito
body:
Here's the general flow we're going to be doing. We want to make sure we have API calls available that handle the events below. Eventually we'll be tying this into ServiceNow as well.

Cognito

AWS Cognito is serving as the Identity management solution for the Dev Portal.

There are two main "objects" to be managed in Cognito.

  • Users/Developers
  • Companies

Events managed in Cognito

  • API
    • Create User/Developer
      • Sending Notification email (done from cognito - can we use a service for this? Sendgrid?)
      • User/Developer can be created in a pending state (pending approval)
      • User created (or creation initiated) via the Cognito API
    • Verify User/Developer
    • User who has registered is sent email to confirm their registration
    • Create Company
      • Same as user; created in a pending state as approval will happen via ServiceNow flow
    • Update User/Developer
      • Update meta data in Cognito via API
    • Update Company
      • User admin of company can update metadata
  • Application Flow
    • Authenticate defined user at login
    • Validate role based access control is in place

Attributes

Developer / User

  • First Name
  • Last Name
  • Company Email address (Confirm)
  • Password (Confirm)
  • Office Phone
  • Mobile Phone
  • Country
  • Job Title

Company

  • Company Name
  • Company Address
  • Company Country
  • Admin User(s)

title: Back button on Send Email need save the filter state
body:
• Edit Standard Page; Clone Standard page; and Edit C&S Issue page, Back Button on top of screen – The Back button should take user back to previous screen.
  • Example - Follow these steps: On the Keyword Search page, Filter the data by Organization – select NFPA, National Fire Protection Association, Select any document by placing a check/tick mark in the leftmost box, click the edit pen symbol in the Actions column, Now you are on the Edit Standard page.
  • At the top of the screen where it says Edit Standard, there is a button to the left of those words pointing back. Click that button.
  • It takes you all the way back to the initial Keyword Search page and clears all the filters.
  • Not desirable. We want this to take the user back to the previous page that shows all of the NFPA documents that were found after filtering.
  • IMPORTANT NOTE: This same thing is true for the back button that appears on the Clone Standard page. AND the same is true for the back button that appears on the Edit C&S Issues page. Please fix the back button on these pages too so that it takes the user back only one page.

title: Web App automatic user logout
body:
• We would like all users to be automatically logged out of the App after a reasonable period of time (Topcoder can pick anywhere between 11 minimum and 24 hours maximum).
  • The users should not remain logged in indefinitely.
  • Today, once a user logs in, it appears like they never need to log in again.  Every time the click a link to visit the App, they are recognized and automatically logged back in when entering the App.  This is not desirable.

title: User Management Password Reset
body:
• We need a way for users who require a login (Data Managers, Admin Approvers, and Admins) to be able to select and change their own passwords.
  • Today, the admin enters the new user in the App on the User Management page and assigns each user a password so the user can login to the App.
  • After an initial login with the admin-assigned password, We want the user to then have the ability to change their password.  The user-selected password would have to follow the rules that we have already established for passwords.
  • The user should be able to create their own password and change it in the future if they wish to do so.  The admin should still have to ability to reset any user’s password if they happen to lose or forget the password the user selected for themselves.

  2. Add support for: lastLoginFrom and lastLoginTo optional query fields to GET /user. When those are present(both of them, no open periods) in request then the results should be filtered on lastLogin field of report's record. Use standarized utc dates format which should be validated.

  • The from xx.xx will be always the date 1 month back from today in format MM/DD/YYYY
  1. Update dashboard pages(admin/user) to do fetch initially 1 month of data(<xx.xx>) from today and store it for later use in caharts and etc. There should be 2 calls made:
  • GET /reports?from=<xx.xx>&to=<todayDate> - this will give all reports in the period. From them count downloaded and completed
  • GET /user?lastLoginFrom=<xx.xx>&lastLoginTo=<todayDate> - this will give the this month visitors/users. From them find the avg per day.

title: Investigating the reason why 9.4.1 cannot be built on macOS.
body:
Reproducible steps on macOS X

$ node -v
v10.14.2
$ npm -v
6.4.1
$ git clone https://github.com/eamodio/vscode-gitlens.git
$ cd vscode-gitlens
$ npm i
$ npm run build
> gitlens@9.4.1 build /Users/honghaowang/Workspace/topcoder/copiloting/Aggregated_Git_Diff_For_VS_Code/9.4.1/vscode-gitlens
> webpack --env.development

No dist is generated

Reason:

All npm run <command> fails. The issue is the size of the package.json file. It is around 220KB. On removing some fields to reduce the file size to around 200KB, npm run commands work fine. I asked npm support here, hope that's fine.

And using yarn fails too.

title: Evaluating Drupal 7 vs 8
body:
Evaluating Drupal 7 vs 8

Drupal 7

Pros

  • Can make new theme compatible
  • Minimal impact to existing module components

Cons

  • Will be harder to recreate designs (writing custom javascript)

Drupal 8

Pros

  • Easy install of theme purchased
  • Drupal has more features ( e.g..rich text page editor, in line edit from admin front end and mobile optimization options)
  • Will be easier to design within the new theme as a compatible version may lose some functionality
  • New theme engine –Twig. Twig is a PHP-based theme engine which allows programmers to write templates using a simpler syntax

Cons

  • Need to test individual modules; may take up a lot of time

title: Investigate import / export of all Zeta resources
body:
@elkhawajah - We've talked for awhile about a way to better import / export Zeta resources from the site. Maybe we can do this as a new feature?

Right now, we can export and import doc-defs from Zeta itself, but we have issues with content and images that still need to be moved.

Current flow

The current flow is to:

  • Zip up all the images from /vagrant/static
  • Export and zip up the mongoDB using mongodump

Problems

This has a few problems:

  1. Restoring the mongodump is destructive, meaning any changes made to content on the server we're restoring to (in the documents) is lost
  2. The images can't be moved directly. In prod, Comcast uses a CDN and has images for all sorts of projects in the same DB, meaning we can't just overwrite the image tables in Mongo. We've had to manually upload images and then update all the documents that use those images, which is time consuming (think 2-300 images).

Solution

What I'd like to have is some sort of feature that we can use to better migrate everything from one environment to another, like dev-->QA or QA-->prod, without having to worry about overwriting anything edited or having to reupload and relink hundreds of images.

I'm open to suggestions on how this could work.

title: Polling for notifications
body:
The client has specified that we check for notifications at these times. We need to make sure both cases are handled in the app. The period polling timespan should be configurable so we can change that relatively easily as they decide how often they want to poll.

  • The Campus App checks for new Notifications by either:
    • Polling: Periodically, e.g. every 10 minutes, checking with Zeta CMS
      • This would allow a loaded, but inactive, Campus App to detect new Notifications
    • Page Load: When a Campus App page, e.g. Home page, is loaded, a check is made for new Notifications

title: Indicators for notifications
body:
These are the client-specified indicators for notifications. We need to make sure these work and are tested:

Polling (#20):

  • If the Campus App is loaded, but not the current app, a red dot and an integer (up to 9, then 9+) appears on the upper right of the Campus App icon on the phone
  • On the Home page, the Notifications (bell in the upper right) icon shows a red dot and integer
  • When not on the Home page, the Home icon in the tab bar shows a red dot (but no integer)
  • On the Notifications list, the new Notification(s) displayed at the top of the list

Home page load:

  • Each time it is loaded, a check is made for new Notifications
  • The Notifications (bell in the upper right) icon shows a red dot and integer
  • When not on the Home page, the Home icon in the tab bar shows a red dot (but no integer)
  • On the Notifications list, the new Notification(s) displayed at the top of the list

Mockup

title: Display of notifications
body:
We received these clarifications that need to be taken into account. A few of these are new, like what order the notifications are shown in, and the change to support multiple lines for a notification.

  • When the Notifications page is viewed, all indicators are removed
  • New Notification(s) appear first in the list with bold font and light blue background
  • Existing Notifications appear with normal font and white background
  • For each Notification:
    • The text is displayed in one or more lines
    • The time elapsed since the Notification was released, in seconds, minutes, hours or days, e.g. “30 seconds ago”, “23 minutes ago”, “4 hours ago”, “3 days ago”

title: Event functionality
body:
@dhruvit_r - We'll start implementing the events functionality with the existing services in the source below, but we'll be doing work to enhance those for Zeta as well. I want to make sure we get the app functionality working in parallel because I'm sure the client is going to have all sorts of tweaks to the information below as we go.

UI: https://gitlab.com/hercules-campus/campus-app-nextgen/issues/25

Supposedly, this is somewhat covered in the Wellness branch of the app, provided by the client, so we may be able to reuse stuff. The code is attached below, but I don't see any way to access the events functionality currently.

Things I see in the code:

  • cordova-plugin-calendar used for adding / removing events from the calendar
  • /www/js/common/calendar.js
  • /www/js/common/calendarevent.js
  • /www/js/views/WellnessCalendarEventView.js
  • /www/js/views/WellnessCalendarListView.js
  • /www/js/views/WellnessCalendarView.js
  • /www/js/views/WellnessHomeView.js (see getCalendarEvents method)

Existing code

https://www.dropbox.com/s/s4no6ni77ksvhmy/comcast-campus-app.zip?dl=1

Event requirements (should already be implemented with Excellis services)

  • When the icon is tapped, 30 days of events are loaded for each calendar selected by the user on the Filters page
  • The starting date is the current date
  • If the “Wellness” calendar has been selected, all events for 30 days are loaded from Optum (can be a separate JSON file)
  • For each selected Zeta CMS calendar, all events for 30 days are loaded (can be separate JSON files)

List view (should already be implemented with Excellis services)

  • The default view is the List view, indicated with a blue list icon in the upper right of the page
    • The Calendar icon to its right is black
  • The Events are displayed in chronological order, by date, start time and then name
  • Each day having events appears as a header with white text on a black band
  • The text format starts with “Today, Month Day”, e.g. “Today, January 24”
  • The text format for the remaining days is “Day of Week, Month Day”, e.g. “Friday, January 25”
  • The list is vertically scrollable
  • Each event has the same format:
    • Event Name
    • Event Calendar Name
    • Event Start Time (but not Start Time – that’s on the detail page)
    • Events that are neither booked nor on the phone calendar have an “info” icon and a right arrow
    • Events that are booked and/or on the phone calendar have a green checkmark indicator, without the “Info” icon or the right arrow (pending what the UI will look like here)

Calendar view

  • The alternate view is the Calendar view, accessed by tapping the black calendar icon in the upper right
    • The List icon turns black
  • The calendar is displayed at the top of the page with the same list of events below it
  • The calendar shows a month at a time, with the starting weekday of Sunday
  • The month is displayed as Month Year, e.g. January 2019
  • The previous month is accessed with the left arrow to the left of the month name
  • The next month is accessed with the right arrow to the right of the month name
  • The current date is outlined by a blue box
  • Events that are booked and/or on the phone calendar have a green dot indicator below the day
  • The table below shows the behavior of the Events List based on the date selected on the calendar. C=Current Date; S=Selected Date; L1-L30=Loaded Dates

Wellness calendar (should already be implemented with Excellis services)

When an Event from the Wellness (Excellis) calendar is selected:

  • The details page shows the associated image at the top of the page
  • The color bar is immediately below the image
  • The Event Date format is Mmm DD, YYYY, e.g. “Jan 24, 2019”
  • The Event Start Time, e.g. “9:00 AM”
  • The Event End Time, e.g. “9:45 AM” (Change from Wellness App)
  • Event Description
  • Event Location and room, e.g. “Comcast Center, Room 24.313 North”
  • Contact Phone Number – From Excellis
  • Blue button labeled “Book Now”
  • When the button is tapped:
    • The blue button is replaced by a green box labeled “:heavy_check_mark: Great! You’re all set!”
    • A link is displayed below the green box “Cancel Appointment”
    • One time only, a modal appears “”Campus” Would Like to Access Your Calendar”
      • If “Don’t Allow” is selected, the modal closes
      • If “Yes” is selected
        • A modal appears “Add <class name> to Your Calendar?”
          • If “Yes” is selected:
            • The Event is added to the phone calendar
            • (Change from Wellness App - The verification modal step is removed)
            • Text appears on detail page “On Your Calendar” (Change from Wellness App)
          • If “No” is selected, the modal closes
    • When the left arrow at the top of the page is tapped, the Events list is displayed (with or without the calendar)
    • The event has only a green checkmark on the right (not info icon and right arrow)
    • A small green dot below the event date indicates that the event is booked
    • When the event is selected, the text “On Your Calendar” appears on the detail page
  • When the “Cancel Appointment” button is tapped:
    • The user’s appointment is cancelled in Optum
    • The Event is removed from the phone calendar
    • Text “On Your Calendar” is removed (Change from Wellness App)
    • The green box is replaced with the original blue button “Book Now”
    • The “Cancel Appointment” link disappears

Zeta calendar functionality

We can just mock the Zeta calendar service with a JSON file or files for now.

When an Event from a Zeta CMS calendar is selected (New functionality):

  • The details page shows the associated Calendar image at the top of the page
  • The color bar is immediately below the image
  • The Event Date format is Mmm DD, YYYY, e.g. “Jan 24, 2019”
  • The Event Start Time, e.g. “9:00 AM”
  • The Event End Time, e.g. “9:45 AM”
  • Event Description, including URLs, email addresses and phone numbers as needed
  • Event Location and room, e.g. “Comcast Center, Room 24.313 North”
  • Blue button labeled “Add to Your Calendar”
  • When the button is tapped:
    • One time only, a modal appears “”Campus” Would Like to Access Your Calendar”
      • If “Don’t Allow” is selected, the modal closes
      • If “Yes” is selected
        • The Event is added to the phone calendar
        • The blue button is replaced by a green box labeled “On Your Calendar!”
        • A link is displayed below the green box “Remove From Calendar”
        • When the left arrow at the top of the page is tapped, the Events list is displayed (with or without the calendar)
        • The event has only a green checkmark on the right (not info icon and right arrow)
        • A small green dot below the event date indicates that the event is booked
  • When the “Remove From Calendar” button is tapped:
    • The Event is removed from the phone calendar
    • The green box is replaced with the original blue button “Add to Your Calendar”
    • The “Remove From Calendar” link disappears

Events filter

When the Events filter is accessed

  • The filter icon on the upper left is tapped by the user
  • The page header consists of:
    • “X” to close the page and make no changes
    • “EVENTS”
    • “Apply Filters” to save the changes to the selected calendars
  • The heading for the list of calendars is “Available Calendars”
  • Each available calendar is listed with the name on the left
  • On the right is a toggle control for selecting or deselecting each calendar
  • The toggles are switched by swiping right or left
  • Tapping the “X” closes the page and returns to the unchanged Events list (an optionally calendar)
  • Tapping “Apply Filters” closes the page and returns to the Events list (and optionally calendar) with a refreshed list of 30 days of events based on the filter changes, starting with the last selected date

title: CCSP investigation
body:
@dhruvit_r - Eventually, our "calendar service" is going to pull from two sources:

  • Zeta (#27)
  • Optum (details TBD)

We have to implement this so that it "plugs in" to a Comcast service called CCSP. To do this, I've cloned an existing guest registration service into the repo so that we have a template and can add / remove things as needed:

https://gitlab.com/hercules-campus/ccsp-calendar-events/tree/develop

I'd like you to have a look, when you have a free moment, to get an idea of what this service will look like

Deployment

In prod, we will add an endpoint in Zeta, configured with the location of the deployed ccsp-calendar-events service. The app will call through that.

Described as:

mobile app requests calendar > zeta defined service endpoint > CCSP service > Zeta calendar json > CCSP modifies data some identifiable way > Zeta Service Endpoint > Data shows in mobile app

Have a look at the current prod config for the campus app endpoints:

For secure storage single call back function is used for success and error. It always check for the condition irrespective of status.
  3. common.js - Remove the duplicate log message in the function clearCache

title: Campus App Accessibility
body:
@seriyvolk83 - This doesn't make a lot of sense to me, from a mobile app standpoint, but let's try to review it as best we can. I don't have much in the way of exact requirements, sorry.

Here are notes from the SOW regarding Accessibility (letters are those referring to the section in the SOW)

  • [ ] V.c Ensure that the focus order of elements is defined and logical to the flow
  • [ ] V.e When using third party libraries, check their accessibility support and try to use libraries that provide support or can be easily modified to add support for accessibility.
  • [ ] V.f For mobile apps, all App Features must function properly when the iOS device has Accessibility mode ON and VoiceOver enabled

Note: For V.f - this applies to android as well, but not sure what the Accessibility mode is called.

title: Add Optum services to the calendar event service
body:
@seriyvolk83 - We need to add Optum to the ccsp-calendar-events service.

You can see the Wellness functionality in the "wellness" branch here: https://gitlab.com/hercules-campus/campus-app/tree/comcast-upstream/Wellness

Note that the codebase is slightly different with some calls to things like https://us-central1-excellis-api.cloudfunctions.net/getEvents

You can use Authorization header value Basic Y29tY2FzdF9hcGk6NmYyN2MwMDMtOTk3ZC00NWE3LWE1ODQtMzY2MGFkYzA2OTJk

You should see an array come back like this:

{
    "events": [
        {
            "eventID": 768074,
            "startDateTime": "2018-09-24T06:30:00",
            "endDateTime": "2018-09-24T07:00:00",
            "eventName": "Healthy Eating Tips",
            "description": "The key to a healthy diet is to eat the right amount of calories for how active you are, so that you balance the energy you consume with the energy you use. If you eat or drink too much, you'll put on weight. If you eat and drink too little, you'll lose weight.",
            "eventImgUrl": "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1529928520614-7c76e2d99740?ixlib=rb-0.3.5&ixid=eyJhcHBfaWQiOjEyMDd9&s=cf7e894b72d57e9292811fa9a9c0058c&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1050&q=80"
        },
...

We need to get this and any other "wellness" API calls integrated into the ccsp-calendar-events service, with the goal being that the initial events is an aggregate of events from:

  • Zeta
  • Optum

We want to add a field to each event that indicates a "calendar_type" of value "Zeta" or "Optum", depending on the source.

We will have shared values, like event ID, start date, end date, name, and description, but anything that's not common between them will have to go into a "blob" field in the JSON response.

The disclosure indicator is more appropriate as it is expanding the information of the event.

  1. Check if user has defautls saved previously
  • YES, load/show them in the modal(current behavior)
  • NO, load/show model's defaults(same as click on "restore defaults" button)

@all ready for pickup

title: Add name field to save draft report
body:
Always we see a single name REPORTNAME for an incomplete report, this supposes to display a name same as a complete report.

Therefore we need to add a name field to save draft report dialog.

  • the field should be populated with some generated value like REPORT_NAME_DATE but the user should be able to edit it.

title: Incomplete report to complete bug
body:

The report should be saved properly. Currently, this error appears.

title: Fix broken .git
body:
See #31

In .git/config

[rally]
_ref=https://rally1.rallydev.com/slm/webservice/v2.0/workspace/55116478086
projectsRef=https://rally1.rallydev.com/slm/webservice/v2.0/Workspace/55116478086/Projects
apiKey=<API-Key>

If the key has a leading _, then the git folder will be broken.

$ git log
fatal: bad config line 33 in file .git/config

Should change _ref to workspaceRef

title: Progress bar investigation
body:
@suppermancool or @obog - With the updated designs, we're seeing the progress bar below a lot. I want to make sure that we have clear, clean CSS and JS that allows us to:

  • Quickly create a progress bar with one or more "nodes"
  • Set the progress value of the progress bar to one or more of the "nodes", filling in the bar to that point. The progress bar can have different colours.
  • Assign icons to each node
  • Change the colour of a node, like the screenshot below.

Once we have this done, we should be able to reuse it in our components and in the site everywhere it's needed.

Anything not explicitly defined in the prototype, like Add User

In scope:

The edits do not have to be persistent back to the JSON file.

title: Fix the issue that the auto time tracking never starts again when AFK in the code editor.
body:
As stated in #30

https://monosnap.com/file/DLCdraCgoERJBjsQpYTtgxkf70eNPC

Steps to reproduce

  1. Run the VSCode rally extension
  2. Select a backlog then the auto time tracking starts.
  3. Switch to the code editor
  4. Be away from the keyboard for at least 10 minutes.
  5. When you come back. The auto time tracking never starts again.
  6. Since then, the auto time tracking also never starts again when you're back to a task.

Expected results

  1. If you are back in the code editor, the auto time tracking should be restarted silently.
  2. If you are back in the task page, you should prompt a question pop up before starting the auto time tracking.

title: Enhanced job description - update with triggering logic
body:
Now that the enhanced job description is - hopefully - completed, we need to ensure that it is used to render pages for the appropriate scenarios.

  1. Any requisition with the JOBCODE= REP1CSTSVCEN or REP2CSTSVCEN - This is the primary scenario in production and will remain as such.
  2. For TPX jobs, its currently pretty f*cked up. It's done literally by the ID of the req; every few weeks, a list of IDs are shared and JWT codes accordingly.

We want to implement 1 for sure. For number 2, our partners don't like how brittle it is but have asked us to research the LOE. If this is something we can hack together such there is a simple component in zeta where you can enter the list of reg ids, that would be a nice temp solution.

body:

  2. When the link is clicked we will begin creation of a new report. The user should be allowed to select a customer for it and then calculator should load with all answers from the old report prefilled. Note this is a new report not editing of the old one.

title: Add backbone.js back into app
body:
As discussed via Slack and email:

Challenge Objectives

  • Cordova app - targeting both iOS and Android
  • This challenge will update the existing "nextgen" campus app to use backbone.js instead of pure Cordova. We have a previous version of the app that uses backbone.js, so we can use that for reference.

Project Background

  • We already have this app in production (version 1.2), but this new version (1.3) is going to be a ground-up rebuild of the app using new plugins and services.
  • The client has asked us to reuse backbone.js in the new version, which we didn't think we needed to do initially.

Technology Stack

  • This challenge will update the existing codebase to use backbone.js (http://backbonejs.org)
  • We will update the router, views, and models to use Backbone, similar to what was seen in the previous codebase
  • Please ensure that all existing functionality in the nextgen codebase continues to work exactly the same as it does now (without backbone.js)
  • Please don’t do anything odd in the setup that will require one platform or another. Since we’re building in Cordova, we should be able to use the code on Linux, Windows, and macOS. Obviously if we want to build and test on iOS, a Mac is still required.

Code access

  • The old app, for reference, is here: https://gitlab.com/hercules-campus/campus-app
  • The new app (which we'll be updating for this challenge) is found here: https://gitlab.com/hercules-campus/campus-app-nextgen

The main requirements of this challenge will be to:

  • Update the router code to use backbone.js
  • Update the views to use backbone.js
  • Update the models to use backbone.js
  • Convert the existing services to backbone.js collections

General Requirements:

We want to maintain the current version of Cordova and plugins used, wherever possible. If we need to change something existing, please get permission in the forum.

The functionality of the existing next-gen app must NOT be changed at all. This is purely a structural code change. It should not affect the user-facing functionality in any way.

A README.md that covers:

  • How to setup Cordova and build the app
  • How to run the app in both the Android and iOS simulator

A Validation.md that covers:

  • Validation of the UI and login flow

title: Get mocks working for swagger doc
body:
@elkhawajah - Our services for the site will be deployed in a Comcast CI / CD pipeline called CCSP. We have just recently done this successfully for the first time with a separate app, and I'd like to continue that momentum here.

I cloned the services here, and this is what we'll update:

https://gitlab.com/herc-dev-prtl/ccsp-devportal-services (Using the develop branch)

I've done some preliminary work to update the gradle info, but you'll have to take it a bit further.

For this ticket let's do the following:

  1. Strip out all the calendar events functionality (used in the other app, not the dev portal)
  2. Using the swagger.yaml file in the docs folder, build out some mocks in a decent namespace (com.xsp.ccspdevportal.*)
  3. Generate some tests to replace the existing ones

Once that is done, we'll deploy in the client's environment for testing, and we'll also deploy on the Zeta server since the client's environment can't be accessed publicly.

title: Selected Commit(s) Details Don't Get Preserved After Tab Changed
body:
Selected commits' file tree and commit details get removed from the right panel, after the tab changed.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Clone/checkout the tc-dev-merge-to-9.4.1 branch.
  2. Run
npm install
npm run build
  1. Open the root directory of project with VSCode.
  2. Start debugging (Press F5)
  3. Open the Command Palette by pressing Ctrl+Shift+P, and select the GitLens: Search Commits command.
  4. Select one or several commits from the left panel.
    • File names and commit details should be listed on the right panel.
  5. On the right side, click on any file to open the diff window. (or change the active tab)
  6. Close the diff window. (or return to the previous tab -- Commit Search page)
  7. Check the right panel.

Expected Result

File tree and commit details should be preserved on the right side, after the tab changed.

Actual Result

File tree and commit details don't get preserved. We see the right panel empty after changed the tab.

Screencast

title: Previous search results are being returned for next searches
body:
After doing a successful search, its returning the same (the previous) results for next searches.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Clone/checkout the tc-dev-merge-to-9.4.1 branch.
  2. Run
npm install
npm run build
  1. Open the root directory of project with VSCode.
  2. Start debugging (Press F5)
  3. Open the Command Palette by pressing Ctrl+Shift+P, and select the GitLens: Search Commits command.
    • All commits should be listed on the left panel.
  4. Enter a keyword in the enter search text field, and click Search.
    • The correct search results (related to keyword) should be shown on the left panel.
  5. Delete the keyword (i.e. clear the enter search text field) and Search again.
  6. Check the results.

Expected Result

Correct results should be returned.

Actual Result

The previous search results are being returned for next searches.

Screencast

title: Service code review
body:
Related to ccsp-events-service:

  • [x] Repositories in the build.gradle also pointing to maven central. It should always point to artifactory alone as JFROG is in sync with maven repo

  • [x] No need of xsp security dependency in service, as we are enabling authentication in gateway. Need to add routing interceptors to restrict call to services directly.

  • [ ] application.properties details needs to be moved to config server. If there is any passwords, needs to encrypted using config server. Currently the URLs are present under resources folder

  • [x] remove CommandLineRunner which is printing all the bean names

  • [x] getAggregatedEvents - (null check before getting the program object)

  • [x] @valid condition for the parameters if it is mandatory field

  • [x] convert calendars methods can be moved to utils class for easy maintenance

  • [x] getOptimusCalendarsSample() test method can be removed

  • [ ] UserSearchRequest is using property based client id and Employee ID. Is this the expected behavior?

  • [ ] we are using the first used and first program from the wellness response. Is this the expected behaviour

  • [x] null check can be done for description also.

 f (e.getProperties() != null) {
   event.setDescription(e.getProperties().getDesc().replace("\n", "\\n"));
   event.setEventName(e.getProperties().getTitle());
   }"
  • [x] If there is a custom response for failure in the services called, it will be good if the same message is forwarded in the response. Currently in the code I can only the success case is handled

title: Implement login
body:
@suppermancool - We have a new service endpoint available for authentication:

/services/login

You can POST to this endpoint on the dev server with a request like this, using Content-Type header value application/json.

{
	"username":"aabbott@topcoder.com",
	"password":"T0pc0d3r!"
}

We want to tie this into the login form here:

http://174.129.220.35:8000/login

Failed login

Note that we need a way to say that login wasn't successful on the page. This was not designed for us, so please put a red warning message underneath the Xfinity logo that just says "Username or password were incorrect" or something like that, on an unsuccessful login attempt.

Curl command for testing

curl -X POST \
  http://174.129.220.35:8000/login \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'cache-control: no-cache' \
  -d '{
	"username":"aabbott@topcoder.com",
	"password":"T0pc0d3r!"
  }'

git branch issue4

title: Investigate running service off of VPN
body:
@elkhawajah - I've updated the dev portal service so that it properly deploys on the client environment and implements a basic Cognito login:

https://gitlab.com/herc-dev-prtl/ccsp-devportal-services

In theory, we should be able to create a secondary build.gradle that works off of the Comcast network for development.

What we can then do is:

  1. Copy in the local build.gradle for development
  2. Remove the local build.gradle when I push to Comcast's Github and deploy to their infrastructure

From what I've been told, their artifactory setup mirrors the Maven central repo, so we should hopefully be able to remove some of the Comcast dependencies and update the maven URLs

title: PRIORITY - Login changes
body:
Changes have been applied to the login flow:

Invalid username or password status code

An invalid username or password will now return an HTTP status code of 401, not 400

User not found

A new handler has been added if the user isn't found

  • HTTP status return of 400
  • Message User not found

Let's handle this with a message that says "Email wasn't found. Would you like to register a new user?" register a new user should be a link to the registration page: http://174.129.220.35:8000/registration/developer/x1 (note new URL: https://gitlab.com/herc-dev-prtl/dev-portal/issues/130)

title: Create new reset password form
body:
We need a form to handle a password reset in Cognito. It will be similar to this page:

http://174.129.220.35:8000/login/password-reset/create-a-new-password

But we need both an old password field and two new password fields. The user at times will be required to change their password. This will require the user to enter their old password and their new password (twice to confirm):

New URL: http://174.129.220.35:8000/login/reset-password-required

Service call

This form will POST a call to:

/serviceendpoints/changePassword

With a body that looks like:

Flow

This flow should be implemented:

  1. User goes to the login page
  2. User logs in, but the challengeName field exists and has value NEW_PASSWORD_REQUIRED (see sample below)
  3. User is automatically redirected to /login/reset-password-required. The values above are all from the initial login response
  4. User resets their password
  5. User is redirected back to /login with a message in green that says "Password reset successfully"
  6. User logs in as normal

Sample users

  • password_reset_test_3

title: 'Asset Management' -> "Protocol"-> "Devices" : "Hide/Show columns" has no checkbox option for "SNMP port" and "SNMP trap port"
body:
Steps:

Click 'Asset Management' -> "Protocol" Add Device. Updated device with proper values so that validation should be passed. Select that device and enable "Expert Mode" from top right corner. Fill SNMP Settings Click "Apply to selected devices" Device details applied.

Now, Click on Device list "Hide/Show columns" Try to enable all expert mode checkboxs.

Now, Observed that "SNMP port" and "SNMP trap port" is not coming in Device details.

Actual: "Hide/Show columns" has no checkbox option for "SNMP port" and "SNMP trap port"

Expected: "Hide/Show columns" should have checkbox option for "SNMP port" and "SNMP trap port" so that it can be seen in Devices.

Reproducible Rate: 3/3

Environment: Windows 8.1 Enterprise, 64 bit Operating System

title: PRIORITY - Create user flow
body:
@suppermancool - The service for the user creation is ready to go. Here are the calls necessary to the service:

Create the user:

POST to /serviceendpoints/createUser

Body sample:

{
   "email": "jmgasper@gmail.com",
   "familyName": "Justin",
   "givenName": "Gasper",
   "phoneNumber": "+17152049099",
   "password":"T0pc0d3r!"
}

Confirm code:

POST to /serviceendpoints/confirmCode

Body sample:

{
	"username":"jmgasper@gmail.com",
	"confirmationCode":"524269"
}

Resend confirmation code

POST to /serviceendpoints/resendCode

Body sample:

{
	"username":"jmgasper@gmail.com"
}

Flow

  1. This will affect: http://174.129.220.35:8000/registration/developer
  2. For now we'll just ignore the drop down for development type and program
  3. Ensure that the user fills out
  • First name (givenName)
  • Last name (familyName)
  • Email
  • Phone number
  • Password (see policy below)
  1. Make the call to create the user above.
  2. On success, a confirmation code will be emailed to the user

Password policy

New UI

We need a new popup or new screen where the user can enter the confirmation code. This should be show after step number 5. This can be a popup that matches the other popups in the UI or a new screen like the Forgot Password screen.

This form will need text like:

"A confirmation code has been sent to email address <the user's email address>. Please enter the code below to confirm your account" "If you haven't received the code, you can request a new code"

request a new code should be a link that makes a service request to resend the code using the API above. The user should see a message like "Code has been resent successfully".

After the user confirms the code, they will get sent to the NDA screen:

http://174.129.220.35:8000/registration/developer/nda

Handling the NDA is a separate ticket here: https://gitlab.com/herc-dev-prtl/dev-portal/issues/133

title: Investigate register a guest screen services
body:
From the customer:

Register a Guest feature is broken. Navigating to Register a Guest screen does not call get_upcoming_visits service. It loads static data. Pull to refresh is not available. Adding new guest form is showing additional fields like comments, send text etc which were not to be a part of 1.3 release.

Can we do the following:

  1. Make sure the service call works
  2. Make sure pull to refresh works
  3. Remove anything we don't have fields for, like comments, send text.

This is the prototype to follow: http://excelliscorp.com/sandbox/Campus-App-UI-Specs/index.html#artboard5

guest registration worked in 1.2. There are no new features, so the only thing we’re doing is porting the form from the previous app as is

but hetal’s right that it should be wired up to that get_upcoming_visits service, which is a service in zeta that proxies to the SAFE system to pull the logged in users visits

title: Fix client feedback issues
body:
1. In the workflow detail the description by the checkbox to mark complete should be reflective of the workflow type. All descriptions state " Large Trade Notification Complete"

  2. When adding a New Plan Event the transaction type is defaulting to the first transaction type available for that plan event type. Field should be a select box requiring user to pick transaction type (default option should be blank)

  3. Clicking outside of a select or dropdown window should close the window (be careful to still allow selecting month and year)

  4. Data from Fund Family Screen is feeding over incorrectly to security screen. Fund Family Contact is populating twice - once in fund family contact field and once in fund family number field (See issue below)

  5. Field in Security Setup under Contact Name should be titled Contract Phone Number not Fund Family Number.

  2. Click Philadelphia
  3. Note the locations listed here. There are 5

The locations are in the json file that's being loaded (buildings.json) but for some reason, when loaded, 2 Logan and 3 Logan are considered duplicates or something?

body:

Going forward, for dev, the user will get a link emailed to them. They can click the link, it will confirm on an AWS page, and then they can manually go back to the signin page to login to the Zeta site. Not ideal, but in prod the link will actually go to Zeta.

title: Remove all `require` in Typescript

title: Clean up service implementation formatting
body: @thomaskranitsas - As described, you wanted better code formatting, so let's do that.

title: Create a topcoder-x usage video
body: create a video demonstrating topcoder X in usage

title: Select home office navigation
body:
From the customer:

After selecting a office from Settings as your Home office, it loads that page in the Home tab but does not make the Home tab selected.

title: Validate flow
body:
@thomaskranitsas - Here's the flow we're going to do in the UI. This will require service updates for how we use Cognito and ServiceNow. What I'd like to do is:

  1. Validate the flow to make sure we have the appropriate services built
  2. Document the flow as it relates to the individual service calls. We'll use this documentation for the UI implementation.

Flow

  • The user will go to the registration page: http://174.129.220.35:8000/registration/developer
  • The user will fill out the form
  • The UI will call the /user endpoint to save the user
  • The user details will be saved in ServiceNow (SN)
  • The UI will call the /company?tld=... endpoint using the domain of the user's email address. For instance, if we use aabbott@topcoder.com, the tld value would be topcoder.com.

Unknown company

  • If no company comes back in the response, we will show the user the company registration page (http://174.129.220.35:8000/registration/x1/company)
  • The user will fill out the company registration page
  • The UI will call the "Create a company" endpoint (POST to /company) to create the company in ServiceNow
  • We'll show some sort of message to indicate that the company and user registration is now pending

Known company

  • If a company comes back in the response, we will look at companyStatus.
    • If Approved, we will get the developer details from SN and create the user in Cognito (new service needed)
    • If Rejected, we will show the user a message that says they can't register
    • If Pending, we will show some other message.

Changes I see

These are the changes I see that need to be made:

  • Right now, saving a user (POST to /user), saves the user in Cognito. We need to edit this to save the user in ServiceNow.
    • We need to update the ServiceNowClient.saveDeveloper method to add the u_password field
    • We need to add program and developmentType as parameters to the POST
  • We need a way to get a single developer from SN and create in Cognito
    • We already have a call to create a user in Cognito with a specified password
    • There is an existing SN API call to get a developer. This should return everything we need to pass to Cognito, including the u_password field containing the password to use.
    • We need a new call to:
      • Get the SN developer
      • Create the user in Cognito
      • Return a response to the caller to indicate that the call worked

Service Now documentation

Here are the available calls right now for SN:

https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/847397/S11NNH9G

title: Company registration form
body:
@suppermancool - The company registration form here: /registration/x1/company needs to be filled in with the backend service call.

Service endpoint: POST /serviceendpoints/createCompany

Sample request:

{
	"companyName":"Justin's Test Company",
	"companyWebsite":"www.justintest1.com",
	"companyPhoneNumber":"+1234567890",
	"domain":"justintest1.com",
	"addressLine1":"123 Main St.",
	"addressLine2":"Unit 123",
	"City":"Anywhere",
	"State":"WI",
	"Zip":"12345",
	"Country":"USA",
	"Requester":"Justin Gasper",
	"RequesterEmail":"jmgasper@gmail.com"
}

Sample response:

{
    "companyId": "5437bd96db807f00ab2cf3c61d96190c",
    "companyTld": "justintest1.com",
    "companyName": "Justin's Test Company",
    "message": "Company created",
    "success": true
}

Notes:

  1. After the form has been submitted successfully, we will show the company-pending page from #150
  2. The requester and requesterEmail fields will come from the developer registration flow. The company page won't be used directly - it will be part of that flow (#150)
  3. The domain field is the domain of the developer's email address. For instance, jmgasper@gmail.com has a domain of gmail.com. aabbott@topcoder.com has a domain of topcoder.com. This is the same as the parsing in #150

title: Create device request ticket from form
body:
The device request form here: /developer/device-request needs to be filled in with the backend service call.

Service endpoint: POST https://comcastdevportaldev.service-now.com/api/now/table/u_device_request_api https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/847397/S11NNH9G#79d63f5f-e0b2-467d-9e73-125f16148be2

The user will be routed to the page from /developer/dashboard

The device request is built according to the mapping here: https://gitlab.com/herc-dev-prtl/dev-portal/wikis/Device-Request-Field-Mapping

The request format is:

{  
   "u_4k_video_playback":"Yes",
   "u_si_company_name":"Advance Solutions Corp",
   "u_si_address_line_1":"300 Penhorn Ave",
   "u_si_address_line_2":"Suite# 5",
   "u_si_city":"Secaucus",
   "u_si_state":"NJ",
   "u_si_zip":"07094",
   "u_si_country":"USA",
   "u_phone":"888-888-8888",
   "u_email":"vidhi.j@asolutionscorp.com",
   "u_number_of_devices":"2",
   "u_si_same_as_ia":"Yes",
   "u_ia_first_name":"",
   "u_ia_last_name":"",
   "u_ia_address_line_1":"",
   "u_ia_address_line_2":"",
   "u_ia_city":"",
   "u_ia_state":"",
   "u_ia_zip":""
  }

Notes:

  • max value for u_number_of_devices is 5

title: Get developer details on login
body:
Right now, we have login tied to Cognito, but we also need to pull developer details from ServiceNow, namely everything returned in the Developer Query API:

https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/847397/S11NNH9G#7988a8b3-21d8-4325-949d-a4b50b3d0fdf

We need to be able to get the company name and status (as companyName and companyStatus) added to a successful login response, at a minimum

body:
1. The website format shouldn't require "http://" in the front of it. We can probably just remove format validation here and just make sure it's filled in for the time being
  2. Address line 2 should not be required.

title: Get devices based on developers email address
body:
@elkhawajah - We need a new service call added to the develop branch of ccsp-devportal-services that takes an email address and returns a set of devices registered to that user. We already make calls to ServiceNow in the ServiceNowClient class in the services.

For now, please just follow the structure to the call that already exists for the other ServiceNow calls.

GET https://comcastdevportaldemo.service-now.com/api/now/table/u_x1_devices?sysparm_query=u_ordered_by.u_email=abc@asolutionscorp.com&sysparm_display_value=true

We need to extract and return the values on the device popup here:

http://174.129.220.35:8000/developer/dashboard/devices

We need:

  • shippingAddress
  • deviceType
  • requestId
  • shippingCarrier
  • id (maps to sys_id)
  • macAddress
  • deviceId
  • deviceStatus
  • modCount
  • requestDate maps to u_request_date
  • requestedBy maps to u_ordered_by.display_value
  • requestStatus --> One of:
    • Request Created
    • Approved
    • Rejected
    • Provisioned
    • Shipped

title: Add service to create a device request
body:
We need a service added to ccsp-devportal-services, in the develop branch, to create a device request in ServiceNow. We can follow the format of the POST to /company, which calls the ServiceNow client, which POSTs to ServiceNow to create a company record.

UI

Not in scope, but we'll use this to determine the format of the POST to ccsp-devportal-services.

Current form with fields that need to be mapped to the POST request to the ccsp-devportal-services:

http://174.129.220.35:8000/developer/device-request

ServiceNow API

POST to : https://comcastdevportaldev.service-now.com/api/now/table/u_device_request_api

https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/847397/S11NNH9G#79d63f5f-e0b2-467d-9e73-125f16148be2

Sample:

curl --location --request POST "https://comcastdevportaldev.service-now.com/api/now/table/u_device_request_api" \
  --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  --data "{  
   \"u_4k_video_playback\":\"Yes\",
   \"u_si_company_name\":\"Advance Solutions Corp\",
   \"u_si_address_line_1\":\"300 Penhorn Ave\",
   \"u_si_address_line_2\":\"Suite# 5\",
   \"u_si_city\":\"Secaucus\",
   \"u_si_state\":\"NJ\",
   \"u_si_zip\":\"07094\",
   \"u_si_country\":\"USA\",
   \"u_phone\":\"888-888-8888\",
   \"u_email\":\"vidhi.j@asolutionscorp.com\",
   \"u_number_of_devices\":\"2\",
   \"u_si_same_as_ia\":\"Yes\",
   \"u_ia_first_name\":\"\",
   \"u_ia_last_name\":\"\",
   \"u_ia_address_line_1\":\"\",

title: Handle missing company status
body:
@thomaskranitsas - One little bug I just noticed - some requests to get a company from SN return a null u_company_status field. We don't handle that properly in the service.

Example:

https://comcastdevportaldemo.service-now.com/api/now/table/u_web_domain?sysparm_query=u_domain=gmail.com&sysparm_display_value=true

We need to handle the null value and just return null in the response as well.

title: Handle invalid company response
body:
@suppermancool - After the user registration, we make the call to /company to get the company details for the user's email domain. That response comes back with two status fields:

  • u_company_status
  • u_status

If a company comes back, we need to add a new handler for u_status:

If u_status is either Invalid or Blacklisted, we need to send the user to a new screen, similar to the success screen, with a message like Your company is invalid. If you believe you have received this message in error, please contact us.

The URL for the invalid screen should be /developer/company-invalid

title: Registration flow change
body:
@suppermancool - We're going to change the registration flow a bit (again) :)

Here's what we'll do:

Please make sure to validate the new role field, thanks!

User registration form

  • Capture the user details from registration, but don't submit them to the API. We'll just store them in the session.
  • Capture the NDA details
  • Query the company based on the user's domain from their email.
    • If status == Valid and companyStatus == Approved, create the user by POST to /user, with role value of "Developer", redirect to the success page
    • If status == Invalid or Blacklisted, redirect to /registration/developer/company-invalid
    • If companyStatus == Rejected, redirect to /registration/developer/company-rejected
    • If companyStatus == Pending, create the user by POST to /user, redirect to /registration/developer/company-pending
    • If no company is returned, redirect to the company registration form (see below)

Company registration form

  • Capture the company registration form details
  • Add these to the JSON for the POST to /user. This call has been updated to accept:
    • User registration details (required)
    • NDA details (required)
    • Company details (optional, if there isn't already a company for the domain)
    • role value of "Admin"

So, we're really just building the POST to /user based on the user registration, NDA details, and the company status retrieved based on the user's email. Based on that, we'll create a request to /user that will run the business logic about what to do with all that data.

New sample requests

Here's a few examples for the different states:

Company is already approved and valid

{
   "email": "jmgasper@wipro.com",
   "familyName": "Justin",
   "givenName": "Gasper",
   "domain": "wipro.com",
   "phoneNumber": "+1234567890",
   "ndaAccepted": true,
   "ndaVersion":"1.0.0.1",
   "ndaAcceptDate":"2019-03-10 12:00:00",
   "status":"Valid",
   "companyStatus":"Approved",
   "password":"T0pc0d3r!",
   "companyName":"Wipro Limited",
   "companyWebsite":"www.wipro.com",
   "role":"Developer"
}

Company is pending (only difference is companyStatus)

{
   "email": "jmgasper@wipro.com",
   "familyName": "Justin",
   "givenName": "Gasper",
   "domain": "wipro.com",
   "phoneNumber": "+1234567890",
   "ndaAccepted": true,
   "ndaVersion":"1.0.0.1",
   "ndaAcceptDate":"2019-03-10 12:00:00",
   "status":"Valid",
   "companyStatus":"Pending Approval",
   "password":"T0pc0d3r!",
   "companyName":"Wipro Limited",
   "companyWebsite":"www.wipro.com",
   "role":"Developer"
}

Company doesn't exist (include company details)

{
   "email": "jmgasper@wiprotest.com",
   "familyName": "Justin",
   "givenName": "Gasper",
   "phoneNumber": "+1234567890",
   "ndaAccepted": true,
   "ndaVersion":"1.0.0.1",
   "ndaAcceptDate":"2019-03-10 12:00:00",
   "password":"T0pc0d3r!",
   "role":"Admin",
   "companyName":"Wipro Limited Test",
   "companyWebsite":"www.wiprotest.com",
   "companyPhoneNumber":"+1234567890",
   "domain": "wiprotest.com",
   "addressLine1":"Test address 1",
   "addressLine2":"Test address 2",
   "city":"Anywhere",
   "state":"WI",
   "zip":"12345",
   "country":"USA"
}

title: Wire Device detail page
body:
@suppermancool - This will be a priority today. This will rely on a new service call being added, but please have a look at the fields expected in the response here to help get a head start: #157

When a row in the device management page is selected, we show a modal with the device details. Those details come from the /serviceendpoints/getDevices?email=... call to the server.

  • Note that the email address used must come from the logged in user, stored in the session.
  • The sample response below shows the various states and possible data
  • If we don't have data for a field on the modal, we will just show blank data, but we should still show the header.
  • The "Comcast Contact" cell and data should be hard-coded.

  • Submitted by will just be the "givenName" and "familyName" values from login

title: Wire Device Management Dashboard page

title: Landscape Mode support
body:
For Android devices, OpenSTF is able to detect if the screen is in Portrait or Landscape mode and adjust the screen of STF accordingly. See this video for reference.

However, currently, OpenSTF doesn't support the same for iOS devices. See this video for reference.

OpenSTF should support the same for iOS devices -Detect the Portrait and Landscape mode automatically -Adjust the screen of STF accordingly -Set the Portrait/Landscape mode icon accordingly.

title: Limit calls in the app
body:
From the customer:

  1. Too many HTTP calls throughout the app: If I navigate to a sub-menu e.g. Ralph’s, the app makes HTTP call to http://cmpapp.qa.zeta.comcast.net/headlesscms/data with body {“url":"/amenities/ccralphs"} and another call with body {"url":"/notifications"} which is a total of 2 HTTP calls.

When I hit the back arrow to go back to parent e.g. Back to Amenities from Ralph’s It makes a call to the same url with body {"url":"/amenities"} and 2 calls with body {"url":"/notifications"} which is a total of 3 calls.

If I keep moving back and forth, total 5 HTTP calls continue to happen. Data also keeps reloading if I switch between tabs. We do not need to load data this frequently.

  • [x] a. Notification call frequency needs to be reduced.
  • [x] b. Data for pages can be cached.
  • [ ] A pull to refresh was present on each page in 1.2 version of the app which has been removed here. Same strategy should have been used. You fetch the data once when you launch the app, cache it and refresh it only if a pull to refresh is executed
  • [x] or atleast 10 mins have passed since that data was last refreshed.

The flow will be the same:

  • list of jobs on JIBE
  • job title will be a URL to jobs-new.comcast.com with the SLUG just as it is for external jobs
  • we will process the slug by querying JWT exactly as we do today
  • the payload will be identical in structure with just a few fields populated that are relevant to employees:
    • Hiring Manager (hiring_manager_firstname, hiring_manager_lastname)
    • Recruiter (recruiter_firstname,recruiter_lastname)

title: Investigate login block on certain pages
body:
@elkhawajah - We need to investigate having the login block on certain pages. This won't be all pages in the app, only some, and for now we're just going to use the login flow we have now, which stores the tokens in the session.

  1. Auth mode in the web app is checked in this function https://gitlab.com/hercules-zeta/zeta/blob/dev-core/web/controllers/index.js#L749
  2. We will create a new Cognito auth model just like ADFS and SiteMinder that handle authorization and permission check, it will redirect to login page or show unathorized page. so above function will have a new if block to do that delegation to the Cognito Auth model.
  3. Cognito Auth Model need to be coded.
  4. In Environments tab in the CMS side we need to add Cognito OAuth as new option, and code the CMS to take the required information for OAuth (i.e. credentials, url, redirect url .. etc)
  5. As agreed we manually create web groups but currently on my installation I am getting erros because MySQL DB is missing table web_groups_users, i need this table definition. But will dig around to see where I can find it.
  6. Then the registration flow in Dev Portal need to be changed to take user first to OAUTH flow to register/login then redirect back to the developer enrollment/registration form (I assume we take more info than what user provide in the Cognito builtin signup page?) but that I need to look at what currently the latest Cognito user schema is. In this step we insert the user as web user in Zeta and associate it with the Web Group based on u_program and I think this step happens only after user is approved to join the program What and where the developer is approved and what currently is being executed in the workflow that I don’t have info about it but there we insert the user as Zeta web user and associate it with the Web Group of that program.

From your discussion above:

  1. This is alright, but we want this to be for only certain pages, not all pages
  2. This will work well
  3. OK
  4. We won't use OAuth for this initial implementation
  5. We won't be storing any user data in MySQL. That's for Zeta users /admins only. Our users won't know about zeta.
  6. As noted, we want to use the current reg and login flow. Users will never be stored in the Zeta DB, only in Cognito.

The main goal is to "protect" the pages that require a login, redirecting the user to /login if required.

title: Production issue - offline/online transition and guest registration
body:
If you register a guest, you get a confirmation screen if registration is successful. Stay on this screen and turn wifi off from iOS control center. The app displays a full screen offline message. Turn wifi on from the control center. Press the "x" button on the offline message to dismiss it. If you monitor network requests, you will see that the app makes another guest registration call in the background as soon as it comes online. This results is duplicate registration. If you keep repeating the steps, multiple registration requests get posted. The issue is in common.js Backbone.findMode method. When the app comes online, it triggers the findMode method again and causes successcallback which is retained from previous request to fire. The solution to this is to clear the successcallback in findMode after it has already executed once.

if(successcallback !== null){
  successcallback();
}
successcallback = null;

title: Prod issue - SSO
body:
When you log in to the app, app.User object is set with pernr, NT id and username. If you kill and re-launch the app now, the app.User object will show these fields as blank. This affects service calls like guest registration where NT id needs to be passed. We discovered this issue yesterday. The fix needs to be added to sso.js file. In our old code, the fields used to be stored in localStorage and read from localStorage. A while back we made the change to store the fields in secureStorage. So the reading logic should also read from secureStorage and this was missed in checkAccessToken function of sso.js. The checkAccessToken code snippet should be replaced with following:

// if(localStorage["username"]){ // app.User.username = localStorage["username"]; // } // if(localStorage["userNTID"]){ // app.User.userNTID = localStorage["userNTID"]; // } app.secureStorage.get(function(value){ app.User.userNTID = value; }, function(error){ app.User.userNTID = ""; }, "userNTID"); app.secureStorage.get(function(value){ app.User.PERNR = value; }, function(error){ app.User.PERNR = ""; }, "pernr"); app.secureStorage.get(function(value){ app.User.username = value; }, function(error){ app.User.username = ""; }, "username");

@elkhawajah - From the discussion in Slack (copied below), we need a way to define a secondary nav for the left-hand nav in the app, not just on the page below, in the screenshot, but on a bunch of documentation pages we also have.

What I'd like is:

  • Define navigation in Global --> Navigation
  • Define a way to have a secondary navigation in the doc-def or document that embeds the navigation options
  • Expose this to the component on the page

This way, I could edit both the header (already working) as one navigation item, and the left-hand nav as another navigation item.

Screenshot

Original discussion

Technically speaking, what is happening right now in the case of top navigation which is the only configurable one in CMS, is that :

  1. User build navigation tree in the GLobal > Nav
  2. User select the top navigation in Project Attributes
  3. Developer build a view file (dust file) that is part of the theme resources (disregard the structure)
  4. Zeta code when preparing a rendering object (context) it go through Global Navigation to get the one configured in doc def, then go pull the Top Navigation project attribute, then get that Global Nav and pass it in the context
  5. when the dust view in step 3 is rendered it reads the children of that navigation and render it in the page. I need to see what is needed to make same thing for any extra navigation

title: CCSP Service - Implement "Stay Logged In"
body:
Original description:

On the login page, we have a field where a user can select to stay logged in. This ticket is to implement this functionality.

If the checkbox is selected when the user successfully logs in, when the user revisits the site at a later time, they will not have to login.

Service requirements

We need a way to implement the token refresh needed to support this, using the refreshToken in the login response. Let's add a service endpoint that handles the token refresh through Cognito.

title: Update Gradle
body:
From the Comcast #artifactory channel on why our build is failing:

  1. First, you all need to update your wrappers to 2.14
  2. Second, you all need to start using the maven range notation.
    https://wiki.sys.comcast.net/display/XSP/Library+Development+Rules#LibraryDevelopmentRules-Syntax
  3. Third, you should all be using the latest versions of the esp gradle plugins, since those have been patched for the artifactory migration and the sonarqube update.
  4. Fourth, if it's a library and you only use the sonar plugin, you can update your gradle wrapper to 4.9 and use the new xsp-gradle-sonar plugin, so long as your build looks like the template here: https://wiki.sys.comcast.net/display/XSP/How+to+Build+Your+Project#HowtoBuildYourProject-LibraryBuilds

That error message you posted says you haven't updated your build.gradle file properly. It says you're still trying to resolve from artifactory.io. Please update your build per the documentation here:
https://wiki.sys.comcast.net/display/XSP/How+to+Build+Your+Project

@jmgasper this will most likely have to happen on DevPortal as well.

title: CCSP Services - Client Review of CCSP Services
body:
1. Proxy details can read the value directly using @Value annotation of Spring instead of parsing the VCAP JSON and extracting the value. We can provide the VCAP path in the properties as a placeholder. (https://github.comcast.com/XSP/xsp-connector/blob/develop/src/main/java/com/comcast/xsp/connector/core/rest/RestClient.md)

  2. com.mashape.unirest.http.Unirest is used to make REST call, is this required? we can use the rest client provided by XSP Connector.If com.mashape.unirest.http.Unirest is needed and custom RestClientFactory is required, we can remove the XSP Connector from the dependencies to avoid multiple beans @ runtime. Also I can see UniREST methods are all static, please verify memory and threads once while running the application.( https://github.com/Kong/unirest-java/issues/140)

  3. configuration values can be moved to properties repo instead of application.properties.

  4. Exception can be handled in separate class using @ControllerAdvice, instead of try catch in the controller class. So that similar exceptions are handled at one place. This way we can avoid duplicates in code too.

  5. Spring boot comes with JSON parser, we can directly receive/send as object instead of parsing the JSON string to object.

  6. Basic validation can be done through JSR annotations(JSON schema has the option to mark the field as mandatory) and @valid annotations. We don’t have to check for not null for each and every field, @valid annotation will take care of it.

  7. Also I can see swagger annotations are included, but configuration is missing. Please add swagger configurations to view the APIs in swagger html.

From Client:

If you have location services on, we are seeing 2 Logan page displayed as Home page even though we are at 3 Logan.

In the buildings.json, the lat longs of 2 logan square and 3 logan square match. They're right across the street from each other. Can we add more precision to the coordinates?

2 Logan Square -> Lat: 39.955753 Long: -75.169766
3 Logan Square -> Lat: 39.955519 Long: -75.169122

I'm not sure how many more decimal places will allow the phone to differentiate, but not be so exact that you have to be standing in the right spot. I'd say if we can add 1 more decimal place, maybe two, that should fix it.

title: Job Description - Finalize
body:
This ticket is to finalize the handling of displaying job descriptions.

As logged before, there are two factors here - first displaying a "regular" job description or an "enhanced" job description and secondly, displaying jobs for employees versus external people. We need to finalize and perfect how we handle these various scenarios.

First, how do i differentiate the two?

  • Enhanced Job Descriptions are currently identified by two factors:
    • if jobcode is REP1CSTSVCEN or REP2CSTSVCEN (implemented #555)
    • if job_id is in a list defined in zeta (this is done)
  • Internal vs external sample code
    • if external_or_internal is "internal", the job is for internal employees
    • if external_or_internal is "external", the job is for external employees

Second, what do we display given the above scenarios?

  • if a job is an "enhanced" job description, it means there is more data for this job in the job listing (/jobs call). the company wants to use the more descriptive template
  • if a job is internal, there are four additional fields available (hiring manager and recruiter - first/last name for each) that we want to display.
  • conversely, if a job is external, we do not want to show those two fields

Tasks for this ticket:

  • [ ] make sure we are using the enhanced job description when the logic above applies and not when it does not
  • [ ] make sure when we show internal jobs, we show the hiring manager and recruiter fields - and when its external, we not only should not show those values but we should hide the fields altogether and make sure the UI does not look bad. meaning we want the spacing to look good under either scenario.

title: Ensure framework for handling internal or external jobs is functional
body:
The key part of supporting internal vs external jobs is being able to change the URL for searching for jobs (calling the JWT service endpoint) and the links when we display job listings (redirecting to the job site).

These are different URLs for internal vs external so once we've decided if a user is internal vs external, we must use the correct URL given the situation.

Searches & Job Description - when we call the API

We call the JWT API in three different scenarios. Here's how the URL will be different in these circumstances for internal vs external.

  • Browse By Locations: When we query JWT for all the jobs, we need to add param external_or_internal=internal to ensure only internal jobs are retrieved. we do not need to specify anything for external because those jobs are returned by default
  • Browse By Teams: Same as above; the url call has external_or_internal=internal
  • Job Descriptions: NO CHANGES NECESSARY - the call with the slug works for both scenarios

Redirecting to JIBE

We link to jibe to show job listings in 5 scenarios. In all cases, we will have different URLs for internal vs external. For browse by teams, this is not a concern because we have the full links defined in zeta but for other four scenarios we need to have a different URL for internal vs external. We want these both to be defined in zeta:

  • Landing page
  • Search Jobs link (header > Jobs dropdown)
  • Search Jobs button
  • Link to jobs we build on Browse By Locations

in conclusion, we need to make sure we can support different urls (or params) for internal and external jobs and define those two urls in the CMS.

title: View and Use of Render function
body:
From Client

Home (any location page) -> Facilities request, tap Done to dismiss then go to Amenities and then switch back to Home tabs issue remains where we see Amenities content in Home tab

@seriyvolk83 in Slack: It's not "tabs issue". It's related to wrong $('.app .contents') usage. While data is loading another page is opened. Hence, $('.app .contents') points to that new page and then first page completes loading, it updates the content in $('.app .contents') (new page). Each view must set reference to $('.app .contents') in the .render method and use it to show content.

Update - The client is also seeing this:

Sometimes it shows a different tab content under Home

I will get screenshots, but I believe it's related to the page index mentioned above. Please test and comment if you need anything. I'll get a video.

title: Device request form cleanup
body:
@suppermancool - This one's been a problem so assigning to you directly.

URL: http://174.129.220.35:8000/developer/device-request

Issue 1

By default, the question Is the shipping address the same as Installation address is set to Yes. This means the user only has to fill out the top part of the form.

Bug: If the user only fills out the top part of the form, the form won't submit because the form validation is still requiring the secondary installation address piece to be filled out.

We need to tie validation to the Yes/No question. If the answer is No, only then is the secondary installation address form required and needs to be validated.

Issue 2

The form itself isn't requiring address line 2 in either the shipping or installation forms, but the backend service is requiring that, so if no address line 2 is provided, the backend service errors out. Is this in our form validation or is this from the Zeta serviceendpoint service?

{ ResponseFromOtherService:

     success: false,
     shippingSameAsInstallationAddress: false,
     require4kVideoPlayback: false } }
{ sendToOtherServiceerror: '3rdparty Api Request responded with code 400' }

Login Task

We want to enable login on the site through a new Employee Login button in the header.

  • Redirect the user to Websec for authentication. We can use kerberos for the pfidpadapterid for now, but we may change to loginform at some point.

Logout Task

Query logged in state

If a user is logged in, we need a way to easily query the logged in state for various pages. Please provide details on how we can do this via Javascript

title: Error messaging
body:
@thomaskranitsas - In general, we can't just send down a Server Error Occurred message. That's going to get us into trouble and isn't helpful at all.

If a call fails, we need to pass down the error message from the upstream server, whether that's SN or Cognito.

For instance, when uploading an attachment, there are errors if an attachment is too big (more than 1MB), or if the ID given doesn't match a record, like {"error":{"detail":"Record doesn't exist or ACL restricts the record retrieval","message":"No Record found"},"status":"failure"}

All of that has to be propagated down to the client in some way so we can:

  1. Properly message this in the UI
  2. Cut down the time spent trolling the logs figuring out why a call failed
