title: Investigate forms and sending data to CCSP service
body:
@elkhawajah - We're a bit stuck on a piece in Zeta:

Problem

We have a couple forms that take images as part of their payload, which is uploaded to the server:

  • http://174.129.220.35:8000/developer/x1/x1-app-registration
  • http://174.129.220.35:8000/developer/xh/certify/section1

What we do currently for forms is send the data directly to CCSP via POST, which is configured on the form in Zeta.

This is done through a Zeta service endpoint, defined in Global --> Service Endpoints

The problem we have is that we haven't had luck sending image uploads through as well.

Investigation

We can change the CCSP services around as needed, so I'd like to build some sort of form that can send the data to CCSP services, through the service endpoints on zeta

If we can get that working, and we can have:

  • Form field values
  • Files uploaded

sent to CCSP, then we should be good to go. We can modify CCSP to perform the necessary operations, as long as we have the full data.

title: Login UI details
body:
@suppermancool - This ticket will cover will need to happen to finish up the login flow:

Login test can be done with csp-test-user / C0mcastDev!

Local deployment

You can check this on the dev server (54.83.37.71) in the Environments tab as well, for comparison. Only the Redirect URI value will need to change to point to localhost.

In Environments, with the latest Zeta, Zeta-Lib, and components:

  • Select Auth Service --> WebSec
  • WebSec URL: https://websec-qa.cable.comcast.com
  • Client ID: comcastjobs
  • Response Type: `code
  • Client Secret: cfe33df4542a450499a893cb8919c806
  • Redirect URI: http://localhost:8000/websec/callback
  • Scope: open,profile
  • PingFederate: kerberos
  • Allowed Employee Types: empty
  • Authorization Code URL: /as/authorization.oauth2
  • Token URL: /as/token.oauth2
  • UserInfo URL: empty

User Info Mapping:

  • UserInfo.Id --> comcast_guid
  • UserInfo.email --> comcast_email
  • UserInfo.name --> name

How to determine if a user is logged in

In the Dust file, you should be able to access these properties:

  • UserInfo.Id
  • UserInfo.email
  • UserInfo.name

If we have UserInfo and the ID property is set, we can assume that the user is logged in.

When a user is logged in (UI)

When a user is logged in, in the UI, we want to:

  • Hide the Employee Login button
  • Show Hello, <UserInfo.name>
  • Show the Sign Out button

Logout

Clicking Sign Out in the header should redirect to /logout. You should attach a redirect_url=<current page> HTTP param to redirect the user back to the same page after they click Sign Out.

Logged in service calls

If a user is logged in, we will make changes to:

  • Search
    • Landing page
    • Header button
    • Jobs dropdown in menu
  • Browse by locations
  • Browse by teams

Search

CMS

We'll want to somehow configure both the endpoints in the CMS, instead of just the one. Is that something we can do through the search redirect?

User logged in

Search URL will look like: https://comcast.staging.jibeapply.com/internal/jobs?<search parameters>

User not logged in

Search URL will look like: https://comcast.staging.jibeapply.com/jobs?<search parameters>

Browse by locations

User logged in

Search URL will look like: https://comcast.staging.jibeapply.com/internal/jobs?<search parameters>

User not logged in

Search URL will look like: https://comcast.staging.jibeapply.com/jobs?<search parameters>

Browse by teams

Doc-def update

We need to differentiate between the different "states" for each individual cell. Right now, each cell has configuration for a single URL. We need to split that into two URLs - one for internal, one for external.

Please make sure the doc-def and document are updated accordingly.

User logged in

We need to add -internal to the end of the team names. Examples of a few:

  • https://comcast.staging.jibeapply.com/sales-internal/jobs
  • https://comcast.staging.jibeapply.com/customer-care-internal/jobs

title: IMPORTANT Internal jobs minor change
body:
When job descriptions are called for internal jobs, we will get passed:

  • job_id = job id of the description
  • `external_or_internal' = internal

When we query jobblaster, we have to append "-internal" to get the correct job description.

Right now we are expecting the job_id that gets passed to the description page to have the "-internal" included; it will not. We need to apply the "-internal" before we query JWT.

Example:

This currently works:

http://54.83.37.71:8000/jobs/description?external_or_internal=internal&job_id=160948-internal

But we will not get the job_id as "160948-internal".

We need to change it so the following URL works:

http://54.83.37.71:8000/jobs/description?external_or_internal=internal&job_id=160948

title: Fix Pernr Call Flow
body:
From Client:

The issue with Shanna's id happened again where she could get the wellness events after logging in, but if she killed and refreshed the app, she only saw zeta events.

From debugger, I noticed that the calls to optum events api was missing a pernr whenever she killed and relaunched
http://ccsp-events-service-dev.g4.app.cloud.comcast.net/events?employeeID=&startDate=2019-03-25&endDate=2019-04-24

I saw error from the keychain that it was unable to find the key "pernr" in keychain

I looked at the code and realized (i think this is what your dev team member was saying too) that the call to saveTokens happens before getPernr call has time to return. getPernr call is asynchronous. So either we have to wait to call saveTokens until after getPernr has returned or add another call to save pernr to keychain after getPernr returns.

title: CCSP - Separate Calendars
body:
In Zeta, There can be multiple calendars:

They are wired up in the /calendar document:

The Headless CMS API Call returns an array of calendars, with the names available here:

Those names should show up as filterable in the app:

In the case shown, the list should be:

  • Philly Events
  • SE Calendar
  • Wellness Events

Make sure to pass through the color property, even though that's not used yet.

Tasks

  • [x] Separate calendars
  • [x] Use the calendar name as the calendarName
  • [x] Pass the color through as calendarColor (string)
  • [ ] Change Data Structure to Break Out Calendars for Filtering

Added Scope

Change the data structure returned from CCSP to something like this:

{
  calendars: [{name, type, color}, {name, type, color}],
  events: [{event}, {event}]
}

Leave the calendar name in each event too, because we may need to show that on the list view. See this issue: https://gitlab.com/hercules-campus/campus-app-nextgen/issues/161

title: Lazy Loading of Calendar Events
body:
Investigate and Estimate Lazy Loading of Events.

Use case:

  1. When you go to the Calendar section, it should load X day's events in list view (based on the config setting - set that to 3 days).
  2. When you scroll and hit the bottom of the list, a loading graphic comes up and it gets the next X days (configurable in the config.js)
  3. When you switch to Calendar view, the list of events under the calendar should only pull the events for the highlighted day on the calendar. Click April 4th, you only see events for April 4th.

Open Questions:

  1. What happens if it loads today and there are less events than off screen? Does it just keep loading until the list goes off screen?

title: CP Investlab: Branding Changes
body:
Site URL :

  • https://cp-investlab.herokuapp.com/
  • for credentials refer to the readme in the attached investlab-master.zip
  • Get access to the GitLab project repo by using this link: https://x.topcoder.com/api/v1/gitlab/groups/registration/de7c6fba-4833-4bc8-8b35-53607f66ebdf-1551805212014

Resources:

  • feedback_20190325_provider_screens.pdf
  • Use this for the base of your submission: investlab-master.zip

Refer to the pdf for more details on the issues listed below:

    1. Main menu: Use sentence case for menu links. E.g. "Trailer Fees" should be "Trailer fees"
    1. Main menu: Align the header with the logo
    1. Use chevrons from the attached icon instead of using plain. icons_small_chevron_right.zip
    1. Please update the fonts such that we only use Credit Suisse Headline font for main headings and messaging or large numbers. Everything else needs to in CS Type EP or CS Type ET if we have tables
    1. "Check the color for trends. This is not a trend color". Update the number pink color to "#d91e19"
    1. Do not use the gradient in this way. Please use Gray 1 "#f1f2f2"
    1. Please never use the step in the content as done here. Use a normal rectangular image attached here (possibly bleed of the right).
    1. Please make sure to use our icons from the functional icon library. icons_small_mail.zip icons_small_phone.zip icons_small_location.zip
    1. Please make sure to have some white space above the footer. Also, add some white space above the image
    1. Do not add unnecessary lines

How to submit?

  • After fixing upload your submission to google drive and then send the link to sandeep.yadav@msn.com or attach the submission in the comments below. If you want to make it secure. Add a password to you zip folder & email it to me at sandeep.yadav@msn.com . Make sure to mention your TC handle name when zipping your submission like "submission-hi4sandy" where hi4sandy is the handle-name.

title: Wellness Event sessionStatusMessage
body:
The client has provided values for sessionStatusMessage, returned by the event detail response from CCSP.

AfterSignUpWindow = 1
AlreadySignedUp = 2
AlreadyWaitListed = 3
BeforeSignUpWindow = 4
ClassHasPassed = 5
ClassIsFull = 6
ClassIsAvailable = 7
EnrollmentRequired = 8
WaitListIsFull = 9
ClassIsCanceled = 10
ClassHasWaitList = 11
SignUpDisabled = 12

Here is the list from the client what they want the UI to do in each case. The strings may change, but the actions are correct:

Code Value Message Button Label
1 AfterSignUpWindow “Signup has passed” Hide
2 AlreadySignedUp "?" Hide
3 AlreadyWaitListed “Already Waitlisted” Hide
4 BeforeSignUpWindow “Too early to sign up” Hide
5 ClassHasPassed “Class has passed” Hide
6 ClassIsFull “Class is full with no waitlist” Hide
7 ClassIsAvailable "Class is available" Show Book Now
8 EnrollmentRequired "Enrollment required" Show Book Now
9 WaitListIsFull “Waitlist is full” Hide
10 ClassIsCanceled “Class is canceled” Hide
11 ClassHasWaitList “Class has waitlist” Show Add to waitlist
12 SignUpDisabled “Signup is Disabled” Hide

Note about X For status 4, in the class detail response, there is a property called signupWindow. This is the duration in minutes before the class begins that you're allowed to signup. If the class is status 4, the app should show a message that says "You can only sign up X hours before the class." where X = signupWindow * 60;

title: Handle the XH certification flow
body:
From the client:

As XH developer or XH admin I would create the request for device certification by clicking on menu item Account --> Certify a Device on the top navigation panel, or by clicking Certify a Device in the side menu on the left.

On selection of this menu item validate that “Digital Home Device Certification” agreement has been accepted by any XH admin of that company.

Scenario: Agreement has not been accepted previously

  1. For XH admin – Present the agreement along with controls to accept. Acceptance is required to submit.
  2. For XH developer – Display an error message like "You cannot proceed with device certification as the agreement is not in place. Please have an administrator from your company agree to the terms. <list of admins>"

Scenario: Agreement has been accepted previously

  1. For XH admin / XH developer – Proceed to the Device Certification request – Section 1 page
  2. Agreement Page – On submit set the agreement status to accepted and proceed to Device Certification request – Section 1 page

Service calls

Check if an agreement has been set for a company:

GET /serviceendpoints/xhCertificationAcceptance?developerEmail=jmgasper_xh@gmail.com

NOTE - We want to make sure that dhdcAccepted is true.

{
    "message": "Certification acceptance retrieved successfully",
    "success": true,
    "role": "Admin",
    "dhdcAccepted": false,
    "XHadmins": [
        {
            "firstname": "Justin",
            "lastname": "Test XH",
            "email": "jmgasper_xh@gmail.com"
        }
    ]
}

Update the agreement status

To be determined - new service endpoint coming soon.

title: Cognito first time registrants for company update
body:
As discussed in email, this ticket is to modify how we handle cognito passwords in certain scenarios, specifically, the first time a developer is registering for a new company.

This refactor will investigate and implement the following:

  1. Upon initiating of developer registration, account in Cognito will be created in an unverified state - meaning the verification link is not sent to the developer.
  2. Upon approval of the company and the service is notified, we will call Cognito and update the state of the Cognito account to be verified, sending the verification link.

Additional note: password is not persisted at any point.

title: Update handling for XH when selecting to start a device cert without an agreement
body:
A XH developer can only start a device certification if their company has agreed to the XH agreement. And only admins can agree to this; regular devs cannot.

The updated logic for this is as follows:

  • When any type of user selects to initiate the device cert flow, we will check if the company has an XH agreement already on file.
    • If they do, the user is routed to /developer/xh/certify/section1
    • If they do not, we will handle them differently if they are an admin or not.
      • If they are an Admin, we will route them to a page where they can agree to the developer terms. Once they accept, they are taken to /developer/xh/certify/section1; if not, they are taken to /developer/xh/dashboard
      • If they are not an Admin, they aren't able to certify a device. We will take them to a message page that will state "Your company must have a signed XH Agreement on file; please contact your company Admin" and have a single button "Next" which takes user back to dashboard

title: Handling different Enhanced Job Description templates
body:
@suppermancool - What do you think? Should we just create a document that only handles the redirect, like we do for the search link? And on the document we could configure the different paths for the different types of descriptions?

@aaabbott - This will increase the time needed for the callback from JIBE because we'll have to get the job details twice - once to handle the redirect and once again to actual render the details.

Currently we are using the same document/doc-def for regular and enhanced job descriptions. there may be a need soon to support a second type of EJD that differs in structure. the question is - can we modify our handling of job descriptions to support use of multiple EJD Docs/Doc-Defs if needed?

Basically...

  1. Jibe links is selected, opening the description page on our site
  2. the description page interrogates the JWT response and based on what it finds, redirects to the appropriate template.

Example:

  1. user selects a retail job
  2. our page gets retail job detail, sees jobcode is RETAILEX which means its an enhanced JD for retail
  3. page redirects to the retail EJD page which renders job accordingly

title: Browse by Location: Update logic of locations by state using new Facet
body:
The /jobsearch endpoint has been augmented to provide us a mapping of state to city. This means we no longer need to rely on the manual mapping we had done in the past.

This is currently available in their prod URL:

https://jobblaster02.jwtbase.com/comcastapi/v2/jobsearch/?format=json

The new facet is country_state_city. It contains:

  • the country-state-city mapping value, for example "US-PA-Philadelphia"
  • the number of jobs in that location

To determine the number of locations in a given state that have jobs, I believe you'd simply search in the country-state-city set of arrays that match "US-" + State Acronym. We don't care about the number of jobs per location, just the number of locations per state that have jobs.

@suppermancool - This will replace the JSON mapping file we currently have in place.

title: Web | Privilege Escalation {SECVULN-9480}
body:
@elkhawajah - Is this an additional check we can do on the backend, similar to the roles (X1 Applications / Digital Home) check that we do now?

Description

Developer user can perform unauthorized actions that modify any end user roles and other information.

Vulnerability Description:

Privilege escalation was identified in the application. The target does not enforce sufficient protections for restricting access to resources. As a consequence, a user can access content and functionality that would otherwise exceed their privileges. Resources may include user information as well as other sensitive data. Ultimately, without additional access controls, the target is vulnerable to unauthorized information disclosure and manipulation.

Note: The identified parameters and URLs may not represent every vulnerable instance in the application. A thorough review of the application's source code should be performed to identify additional areas that may be susceptible and should be corrected using the procedures in the Recommendation section.

Threat Actor Description

An attacker could gain access to sensitive information, credentials, or modify application state with a privilege escalation vulnerability.

Threat Impact Description

Threat Actor is able change the role from Developer to Admin in the Local storage to access unauthorized functionalities.

Validation Steps: Tested on: Firefox

  1. Login into the application https://devportal.comcast.com as Developer
  2. Right click and click on Inspect Element then choose Storage option - Session storage
  3. Change the value of "role" from "Developer" to "Admin"
  4. Refresh the page to observe the change. Developer user is now Admin user with access to restricted functions such as "User Management".

Notes and References:

Implement restrictions that will not allow normal user processing of requests or returning admin functionality. Perform server-side authorization checks prior to granting access to restricted data and functionality to prevent unauthorized access to resources that require elevated permissions.

title: Web | Cross-site scripting (stored) {SAS-9469}
body:
Description

The application is vulnerable to Stored Cross Site Scripting.

Vulnerability Description:

Stored cross-site scripting vulnerabilities arise when user input is stored and later embedded into the application's responses in an unsafe way. An attacker can use the vulnerability to inject malicious JavaScript code into the application, which will execute within the browser of any user who views the relevant application content.

The attacker-supplied code can perform a wide variety of actions, such as stealing victims' session tokens or login credentials, performing arbitrary actions on their behalf, and logging their keystrokes.

Methods for introducing malicious content include any function where request parameters or headers are processed and stored by the application, and any out-of-band channel whereby data can be introduced into the application's processing space (for example, email messages sent over SMTP that are ultimately rendered within a web mail application).

Threat Actor Description:

The security impact of cross-site scripting vulnerabilities is dependent upon the nature of the vulnerable application, the kinds of data and functionality that it contains, and the other applications that belong to the same domain and organization. If the application is used only to display non-sensitive public content, with no authentication or access control functionality, then a cross-site scripting flaw may be considered low risk. However, if the same application resides on a domain that can access cookies for other more security-critical applications, then the vulnerability could be used to attack those other applications, and so may be considered high risk. Similarly, if the organization that owns the application is a likely target for phishing attacks, then the vulnerability could be leveraged to lend credibility to such attacks, by injecting Trojan functionality into the vulnerable application and exploiting users' trust in the organization in order to capture credentials for other applications that it owns. In many kinds of application, such as those providing online banking functionality, cross-site scripting should always be considered high risk.

Threat Impact Description:

The attacker-supplied code can perform a wide variety of actions, such as stealing victims' session tokens or login credentials, performing arbitrary actions on their behalf, and logging their keystrokes.

Validation Steps:

  1. Log into the application https://devportal.comcast.com
  2. From "Programs" dropdown click "X1 Apps platform"
  1. From "Account" dropdown click "create app" to to register new application
  2. Insert following xss payload in development URL field <script>alert(111)</script> and submit the form
  3. Observe the XSS is stored and reflected when any logged in user visits vulnerable page (https://devportal.comcast.com/developer/x1/dashboard/apps)

Notes and References:

In most situations where user-controllable data is copied into application responses, cross-site scripting attacks can be prevented using two layers of defenses:

Input should be validated as strictly as possible on arrival, given the kind of content that it is expected to contain. For example, personal names should consist of alphabetical and a small range of typographical characters, and be relatively short; a year of birth should consist of exactly four numerals; email addresses should match a well-defined regular expression. Input which fails the validation should be rejected, not sanitized. User input should be HTML-encoded at any point where it is copied into application responses. All HTML metacharacters, including <> "" ' and =, should be replaced with the corresponding HTML entities (< > etc.)."

Note: The identified parameters and URLs may not represent every vulnerable instance in the application. A thorough review of the application's source code should be performed to identify additional areas that may be susceptible and should be corrected using the procedures in the Recommendation section.

title: Web | Cross Site Request Forgery {SECVULN-9472}
body:
@elkhawajah - The client has fixed the issue below in zeta-features-forms, but our branch isn't sync'd up with that change. The change doesn't merge gracefully, so we'll have to do that manually. Attached is the patch file that we want to merge in.

0001-CSRF-Token-issue-fix-added.patch

Description

Application is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) which forces a user to execute unwanted actions on a web application in which they're currently authenticated.

Vulnerability Description:

Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attack forces a user to execute unwanted actions on a web application in which they're currently authenticated. Using this CSRF attack threat actor can force the user to request a new device.

Note: The identified functionalities may not represent every vulnerable instance in the application. A thorough review of the application's source code should be performed to identify additional areas that may be susceptible and should be corrected using the procedures in the Recommendation section.

Threat Actor Description:

If an administrative user has an active session to the administrative area while visiting a malicious site, JavaScript calls may unknowingly execute administrative actions under the context of the administrative authenticated session.

Threat Impact Description:

A successful CSRF exploit can compromise end user data and operations in the case of a normal user. If the targeted end user is the administrator account, this can compromise the entire web application.

Validation Steps:

  1. Log into the application https://devportal.comcast.com
  2. From "Programs" dropdown click "X1 Apps platform"
  3. From "Account" dropdown click "Request Device" to to register new application
  4. Fill the form and intercept the request using Burp proxy
  5. Create CSRF Poc as shown in the image and save it in an HTML file
  6. Logout and login again.
  7. Open the HTML file in a new tab and click on "Submit Request"
  8. Observe that the changes are made

Recommended Fix:

The most effective way to protect against CSRF vulnerabilities is to include within relevant requests an additional token that is not transmitted in a cookie: for example, a parameter in a hidden form field. This additional token should contain sufficient entropy, and be generated using a cryptographic random number generator, such that it is not feasible for an attacker to determine or predict the value of any token that was issued to another user. The token should be associated with the user's session, and the application should validate that the correct token is received before performing any action resulting from the request.

title: Support 2FA on login
body:
@suppermancool - We're going to enable 2FA with SMS on login.

What that means is that when a user with 2FA enabled logs in, they'll be prompted on a new screen to enter a code that's sent as an SMS to their phone before they're fully logged in.

Service response

We know a user is required to do 2FA if the challengeName value on the login response is available.

This is a sample for login with SMS MFA enabled:

Invalid code

We need to handle the case where the code given is invalid by allowing the user to retry the login. If a code entry fails, they should be able to go back to the login screen and retry with their username and password to generate a new code.

If a code is expired, we also need to handle that case. The codes seem to last 10-15 minutes.

title: NDA widget updates
body:
@suppermancool - I have more requirements from the client here:

  1. The widgets themselves should contain the content for the NDA. We won't have this configurable on the document, it will be configurable on the widget
  2. There should be 3 widgets:
  • X1 NDA
  • XH NDA
  • Digital Home Device Certification Agreement
  1. The widgets will have data fields for:
  • Agreement name
  • Agreement text
  • Agreement version

Usage

The X1 and XH NDA agreements will be used during registration:

  1. If a user selects X1 Applications during registration, they will get presented with the X1 NDA. When sending the NDA details to the server, we need to send the version from the widget along as part of registration.

  2. If a user selects Digital Home during registration, they will get presented with the XH NDA. When sending the NDA details to the server, we need to send the version from the widget along as part of registration.

The Digital Home Device Certification Agreement is the same, but in the XH certification area instead of registration

title: SECVULN-9411 Encrypt Google API key in plist file
body:
From the client:

Campus applications uses Plist file to API key which is not a good practice to be in place. Suggested solution:

  • Avoid storing sensitive information on the plist files.
  • Try to cross check and remove all the sensitive information’s in the production builds before pushing it to the App Store.
  • Encrypt all the sensitive information before saving it in any of the local storage files.

title: SECVULN-9413 Blank out to task switcher
body:
From the client:

When app moves to the background, iOS captures a snapshot of your app and this snapshot is used to represent your application in the task switcher. This snapshot may contain sensitive information. Suggested solution: It is recommended by adding dummy image for entire screen while app enters background.

title: University Job Listings - Support Updated Queries
body:
@suppermancool - Can you enhance the component that has the list of jobs to support this new type of query please?

The four University pages in the new career site are intended to show a subset of the jobs that are specific for each of the four pages. The job data has, until now, not supported that. It does now and we want to re-add the job listing component back in.

The four subtypes are:

  • MBA Intern
  • Tech Intern
  • CCIP Intern
  • Finance Intern

The job data will have keywords embedded for each of those four scenarios; we will simply have to query accordingly to get the results. They have updated the search API that we use (/comcastapi/v2/jobsearch/) slightly, so that now they can search on the title field (as opposed to the q=xxxx search, which searches multiple fields)

Specifically, the new parameter to use is title__icontains=searchterm (that’s the word title, followed by 2 (two) underscores ‘_’ followed by the word icontains)

So our four queries will be:

  • MBA Intern: https://jobblaster02-staging.jwtbase.com/comcastapi/v2/jobsearch/?format=json&external_or_internal=external&title__icontains=mba%20intern
  • Tech Intern: https://jobblaster02-staging.jwtbase.com/comcastapi/v2/jobsearch/?format=json&external_or_internal=external&title__icontains=tech%20intern
  • CCIP Intern: https://jobblaster02-staging.jwtbase.com/comcastapi/v2/jobsearch/?format=json&external_or_internal=external&title__icontains=ccip%20intern
  • Finance Intern: https://jobblaster02-staging.jwtbase.com/comcastapi/v2/jobsearch/?format=json&external_or_internal=external&title__icontains=finance%20intern

Note the internal vs external flag is still relevant.

Ideally, this is as simple as injecting these new queries into the CMS.

title: Add "Track to Hire" code
body:
The jobs on the career site will also be available on other job sites. These sites will contain links to the job descriptions.

To make sure these referral sites are properly credited, they will be attaching a param to the query - IT. We need to get this value and include it when we build the "Get Started" link - the button where the user starts the apply process.

Note: A user could come to the site via one of the referrals but navigate and choose to apply to another Comcast job; in this instance, we STILL need to pass the IT value to jibe because the referral should still be captured and honored.

title: Update employee login for ADFS flow
body:
We now have ADFS working for Career Site. ADFS is an alternative authentication technique our customer has to the current websec. The good part of ADFS is that support for it is built into Zeta.

Once ADFS is configured in a zeta environment, all we need to do is alter the permissions for a document such that it is private. When a private document is accessed by a user, it will invoke the configured environment's authentication. Once ADFS is configured and enabled, it means it will invoke this flow.

Once the user successfully authenticates, they will be redirected back to us as follows:

  • redirect url: <site url>/callback
  • the following variables should be populated with the user details
    • UserInfo.username
    • UserInfo.firstname
    • UserInfo.lastname
    • UserInfo.email

What we want to do is modify our current flow such that if you select Employee Login button, it:

  • invokes the ADFS auth flow
  • once user authenticates, they are redirected back to our site
  • once redirected back to our site, we "identify" they are logged in and hide the login button and change all job links to the internal endpoints

I'm open to how we solve this. Seems like if we leverage the zeta ADFS built-in implementation, we just need to:

  • create a document that has permissions private
  • update employee login button to point to this private page
  • when the page is hit, because it is private it will trigger ADFS - meaning, the user will be redirected, prompted to authenticate and, if successful, redirected back to us at url <URL>/callback
  • when redirected back to us, we want to trigger the logic we already have to handle internal vs external. from a user perspective, once redirected they will be on the page and see no login button and all links will point to internal counterparts.

For testing in localhost and QA, here's the details:

  • Client Id: 1c134ded-5247-4d0f-a440-e6f72bd1211a
  • login details: aabbot002c / HPEK5NIfoETF8nb3r!a&b7KTkovJo1
  • if MFA triggered, please email me & ping me on slack

title: Missing calendar dates in list view
body: When viewing the calendar in list view, when you scroll to the bottom, as the page refreshes, the next day that should be listed is missing. When app makes a call to events service, it passes first set of date with start date Apr 27th and end date Apr 30th. Then when you scroll down to the bottom, it makes a call with start date May 1st and end date as May 4th. The problem that happens is that events with start date Apr 30th do not show up in either of the queries and are entirely missed. They show up when you select Apr 30th in the calendar view (not list view) because in that case we call the service with start date Apr 30th and end date May 1st. We may probably need to overlap our queries - Apr 27 to Apr 30, Apr 30 to May 3, May 3 to May 6 and so on.

title: Add confirmSignUp page
body:
@suppermancool - We're working on doing the sign up confirmation on the site vs. on Amazon's site.

URL

The URL will be something like this:

const url = 'http://174.129.220.35:8000/confirmSignup'
        
const link = `<a href="${url}?code=${codeParameter}&username=${userName}&clientId=${clientId}&region=${region}&email=${email}" target="_blank">here</a>`

We can expect parameters:

  • code
  • username
  • clientId
  • region
  • email

Service

We'll take the details and POST to /serviceendpoints/confirmSignUp

{
    "username": <username from request>,
    "confirmationCode": <code from request>
}

Handling the result

If the result is successful, we'll redirect the user to a success page

If the result is unsuccessful, we'll redirect the user to an error page

Both of these pages should be configurable on the document for /confirmSignUp

Success page

This will have the text:

Your email address has been confirmed successfully

and a button called Sign in that redirects to the /login page

Error page

This will have the text:

Your email address failed to be confirmed

title: Role-Based Security on API Calls
body:
Get Roles from SN and validate that the user/role can access the resource.

From our conversation:

title: trace Device Request call through Zeta
body:
performance testing has indicated this particular call is greater than the 5 second SLA. we want to figure out why. indications are that it is on the html/zeta level. my suspicion is if it is, its due to the zeta framework and not our implementation on top of it. I need a few data points and investigation to do so.

My request is some instrumentation and analysis into one call - Device Request. This is a X1 user logging in and submitting a request for a X1 device. This is currently in performance testing over 7 seconds.

Again, this is not a question of our implementation. It is VERY likely zeta and their multiple layers and routes. but we need to be able to provide some insight - and better yet - data as to where the time in a device request is being sent within the zeta layer.

title: Add timings to all SN and Cognito calls

title: Use ServiceNow instead of Cognito for first last name
body:
If users are created manually, when they are created in Cognito, we do not have the ability to set their first and last names. The issue this causes is when they login, the first name and last name used in the app (i think only in dropdown) is populated with one (or both) of these values.

This ticket will change the app to use the first and last name maintained in Service Now over what is returned from Cognito.

title: Handle Stay Signed In on login screen
body:
On the login screen, we have a Stay signed in checkbox.

If this checkbox is checked, we need to store the auth token locally to the client's browser as a cookie, in local storage, etc...

When the token expires, we want to ensure that we POST to /serviceendpoints/refreshToken with the Identity_Authorization header set with the current token. That service should respond with a new token we can use.

title: Use new endpoint on dashboard
body:
@suppermancool - Instead of retrieving all users and counting them for the XH and X1 dashboards, we're going to use a new endpoint

Examples:

  • http://174.129.220.35:8000/serviceendpoints/dashboardData?companyName=ACME Company&program=X1 Applications
  • http://174.129.220.35:8000/serviceendpoints/dashboardData?companyName=ACME Company&program=Digital Home

Response will look like:

{
    "message": "Dashboard data found",
    "success": true,
    "active": 6,
    "deactivated": 1,
    "total": 7
}

This is the count of users in each of those states. We will use this on the dashboard only, for the User Management section

title: Update to forgot password flow
body:
We want to smooth the forgot password flow:

Current:

  • User selects Forgot Password
  • User Enters Email Address
  • Zeta verifies email address exists in site
    • How would you like to reset your password? Email or test?
  • Create a new password (enter the verification code)

The problem with this Step 3. When MFA is enabled, users will have the phone numbers marked as verified in Cognito. If a Cognito user has a verified phone number, it will not let you send a forgot password code to email - it will always go to phone.

To address, we propose simply removing this step from the flow. The new flow would be:

  • User selects Forgot Password
  • User Enters Email Address
  • Zeta verifies email address exists in site
  • Create a new password (enter the verification code you received in email or text)

Register User

X1 & XH Dashboards

title: - Migrate from Old DB Structure to Mongoose-managed DB
body:
The old site was a Concrete5 PHP site. The structure of the DB tables wasn't managed, they were created by scripts and grew from there. Some problems:

  • There are a lot of now unused tables
  • Tables don't have indexes or foreign keys defined.
  • Tables that were system tables (Mainly User) have a bunch of unnecessary columns.

I need to migrate from the old server to a new MySQL/MariaDB server, so I want sequelize to take over management of the tables, but need current production data in there.

What I need to be able to do:

  1. Create a database on the new destination server
  2. Set up the config to point at that database
  3. Deploy the code
  4. Run the site - sequelize should create the tables it needs
  5. Run some kind of ETL from the existing database (in docs/whattrivia-db-export.tgz) to get data with necessary columns into the new database
  • This can be an npm run script with connectivity to the source DB and the destination DB, or a script to extract an SQL file to import into the destination, whatever's easiest and most versatile.

Some problems:

  1. I would like to maintain the values for created, createdBy, modified, modifiedBy. If they exist on the old table, they need to be added to the new Sequelize model
  2. I think, because of the existing data and foreign keys, order the models/data are loaded is important.

title: Eaton logo update
body:
Here is the update from client, as you can see below, we have 2 logo, the top one is red circled, and bottom one with green circle

Now the red circled logo need to replace like the below image

Now the bottom Logo with Green Circle, for which we need to call an API like below and display like the above image.

Here are the API details

A) Installer logo:
1.       Every time mobile app wants to check the new logo, it has to call next rest method:
 
GET https://localhost/m2m-web-admin/rest/user/installerLogo/byMobileApp/<applicationId>
Headers:
jwt: eyJhbGciOiJIUzUxMiJ9.eyJzdWIiOiJhbG1vbGV2NEB5YW5kZXgucnUiLCJpc3MiOiJNb2JpbGUgVXNlciIsImV4cCI6MTUwNzEyNDQ0NX0.Pdu2LrSn3qYedNh4srdan6tm-GmhTrKVWXFnB2h0MVm1tM3x9LahQpeBrcTS85WqFKsSPdoInqu6hvCYZkeZ5g
 
If it is first request for logo, mobile application send the request above. If it is second request, then mobile app will provide one more query parameter logo_hash, which will be returned in response for this request. This query parameter contains hash of the logo image.
e.g. https://www.eatonsecureconnect.com/m2m-eaton-web/rest/mobileApplication/installerLogo/byMobileApp/a10a93111cc44bb4?logo_hash=2dc
 
2.       Cloud compare hashes of stored logo with hash received in the header. If they are the same cloud will respond with 204 No content. If headers are different, cloud will response with 200 OK.
Content-type will be “image/jpg”. Also response will contains query parameter  logo_hash  with hash of new image.
3.       Mobile app will store these hash for next interaction.
4.       If  logo_hash  is not presented, cloud send response with logo and logo_hash in the header.
5.       If logo doesn’t exist on the cloud, then cloud will send 404 response.
 
 
Installer logo is not to be shown in side menu, it is to be shown when app launches.  The use case is if instller logo is configured at cloud then using REST API fetch installer logo and show it otherwise show default splash screen.

Here is the lite white eaton logo

title: Random issue during login - Sometimes when user selects Employee Login, user must select the employee button twice to login
body:
We are seeing some users are reporting that when the first they hit the website, they see the following behavior:

  • It all works, but when I try to log in the first time it doesn’t work. It just brings me back to the homepage not logged in. As soon as I click it again, I’m then logged in and everything works fine.

The console logs show a 401. I know this is expected in some scenarios - can we make sure there are no holes in our logic for the first time users?

Update 1

I connected to the TeamViewer and tested from Chrome. Tried to login as myself and saw this:

Update 2

I can replicate it regularly now on the TeamViewer.

  1. First clean the browser history and cache
  2. Reload page
  3. Select Employee Login button
  4. I see a 401 screen with the URL of: https://jobs-new.comcast.com/login-adfs?&redirect_url=/

  1. If i hit refresh on this page, it remains on the page.

  1. If i edit the URL and reload https://jobs-new.comcast.com, the page loads and renders fine - but the employee button is not displayed - but the user's name is not shown either.

  1. If I reload the page again, it now shows the user's name.

Here are the logs that were captured:

  • log1.txt
  • log2.txt
  • log3.txt
  • log4.txt

title: Frontend Security Token Timeout
body:
If you log into the site and view the dashboard, everything works as expected. If you let your login go "stale" (for an hour or so) the requests start failing

There is a refreshToken endpoint in CCSP. The frontend should call this to refresh the token.

@suppermancool - If the user has not checked Stay Signed In at login, and the token expires, we need to:

  • Detect that the token has expired
  • Automatically log the user out and send them to the sign in screen.

cc: @thomaskranitsas

title: Handle token expiration in services
body:
@thomaskranitsas - We need to add some token handling to the services:

In each call that looks at the token, we need to:

  • Verify the token hasn't expired yet
  • If it's close to expiring (within a configurable window, like 15 minutes)
    • Refresh the token
    • Use the refreshed token for validation
    • Send the refreshed token value down as a set-cookie so the client gets the new cookie

If the token has expired without being renewed, we'll still send down an error as we do now - this is only for when the token is nearing expiration while the user is using the site.

This way, while the user is navigating the site, the cookie will be kept up to date.

title: Better handling of callback error
body:
@suppermancool - We've spent a lot of time digging into the callback errors with login. I don't think I'll be able to fix it without a bunch of help from the client, which we are going to ask for.

In the meantime, let's make some changes to the UI and flow to make the error more visible to the user:

  • Build a new page in the CMS called /callback-error
  • POST or somehow send the error details from the /callback handler to that page
  • Display the error text on the screen, with additional text editable through the CMS so we can redirect the user to retry their login
  • At the bottom of the page, add a Retry Login button that attempts to take the user back through the login flow.
    • If login is successful here, we'll just redirect to /

Configuring App Transport Security (ATS) Exception
body:
This is for the SAS finding SECVULN-9415 which mentioned that we had ATS disabled in the app. To have it enabled and for the app to work correctly, info.plist file should have a dictionary that looks like this:

<key>NSAppTransportSecurity</key>
	<dict>
		<key>NSExceptionDomains</key>
		<dict>
			<key>cmpapp.qa.zeta.comcast.net</key>
			<dict>
				<key>NSExceptionAllowsInsecureHTTPLoads</key>
				<true/>
			</dict>
			<key>teamcomcast.sc.omtrdc.net</key>
			<dict>
				<key>NSExceptionAllowsInsecureHTTPLoads</key>
				<true/>
			</dict>
		</dict>
		<key>NSAllowsArbitraryLoads</key>
		<false/>
		<key>NSAllowsArbitraryLoadsInWebContent</key>
		<true/>
	</dict>

For Cordova apps, the way to do this is to use Cordova whitelist plugin https://github.com/apache/cordova-plugin-whitelist. Referring to this, I changed the config.xml file access and allow-navigation tags as below:

<access origin="http://cmpapp.qa.zeta.comcast.net" />
<access origin="http://teamcomcast.sc.omtrdc.net" />
<access allows-arbitrary-loads-in-web-content="true" origin="*" />
<allow-navigation href="http://cmpapp.qa.zeta.comcast.net" />

However, this produces the following entry in info.plist

<key>NSAppTransportSecurity</key>
	<dict>
		<key>NSExceptionDomains</key>
		<dict>
			<key>cmpapp.qa.zeta.comcast.net</key>
			<dict>
				<key>NSExceptionAllowsInsecureHTTPLoads</key>
				<true/>
			</dict>
			<key>teamcomcast.sc.omtrdc.net</key>
			<dict>
				<key>NSExceptionAllowsInsecureHTTPLoads</key>
				<true/>
			</dict>
		</dict>
		<key>NSAllowsArbitraryLoads</key>
		<true/>
		<key>NSAllowsArbitraryLoadsInWebContent</key>
		<true/>
	</dict>

The NSAllowsArbitraryLoads key remains true when it should be false. Is there something in the config.xml that needs to be modified to get the correct entries in info.plist?

I have also tried using https://github.com/leecrossley/cordova-plugin-transport-security plugin but it doesn't work either. The forums mentioned that this plugin is no longer needed and the whitelist plugin should do the work.

title: Investigate failing headless CMS feature
body:
@elkhawajah - We're seeing failures in this call to the headless CMS. You may need to use TeamViewer to get to the CMS because the timeout fix we applied in careers and devportal hasn't been deployed in campus.

  • CMS (on VPN): http://cmpapp.qa.zeta.comcast.net:8010/#/entities/docdefs
  • Headless CMS feature: https://gitlab.com/hercules-zeta/zeta-feature-headlesscms
curl -X POST \
  http://cmpapp.qa.zeta.comcast.net/headlesscms/data \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Origin: campus-app' \
  -H 'Postman-Token: eb331bdd-bf67-4204-8979-c0c7f1dbed32' \
  -H 'cache-control: no-cache' \
  -d '{
	"url":"/amenities/around-campus"
}'

We're seeing a 502 come back, and this is in the logs:

TypeError: undefined is not a function
    at /export/home/appjs/zeta/features/headlesscms/models/FieldsProcessor.js:203:79
    at Array.forEach (native)
    at iterateFn (/export/home/appjs/zeta/features/headlesscms/models/FieldsProcessor.js:184:60)
    at /export/home/appjs/zeta/features/headlesscms/models/FieldsProcessor.js:235:41
    at Query.<anonymous> (/export/home/appjs/zeta/node_modules/zeta/node_modules/mongoose/lib/model.js:4093:16)
    at /export/home/appjs/zeta/node_modules/zeta/node_modules/mongoose/node_modules/kareem/index.js:273:21
    at /export/home/appjs/zeta/node_modules/zeta/node_modules/mongoose/node_modules/kareem/index.js:131:16
    at process._tickCallback (node.js:355:11)

From @rootelement :

The problem from the server with the /amenities/around-campus was that there was no “rows” under the food services section of that document. I dont’ know why it works in QA but doesn’t in Prod, but I expect maybe it was a tweak to the doc def?

We don't want this test value showing, so we'd like to fix the headless CMS so that it works properly without having to fill in this value.

title: SCG-DCP  - (Edit Order Management)
body:
<p>Welcome to the "<strong>SCG-DCP challenge</strong>". In this challenge, we are looking for your great development skills to quickly develop an <strong>AngularJS</strong> application based on the given wireframe.<br />

<p><span style="color:rgb(0, 124, 52)">Let us know any question you have!</span></p>

<h2>General requirements</h2>

<h4>Layout</h4> <ul> <li>layout should be fluid</li> </ul>

<h4>Framework-specific</h4>

<ul> <li>Use JSON format files for the application data.</li> <li>Create services to fetch data from JSON format files.</li> </ul>

<h4>Code Formatting</h4>

<ul> <li>Please use clean INDENTATION for all HTML code so future developers can follow the code.</li> <li>Provide comments on the page elements to give a clear explanation of the code usage. The goal is to help future developers understand the code.</li> <li>Use appropriate linters to validate your code.</li> </ul>

<h4>HTML Specific</h4>

<ul> <li>HTML should be valid HTML5 compliant.</li> <li>All HTML code naming should not have any conflicts or errors.</li> <li>Element and Attribute names should be in lowercase and use a "-" or camel naming to separate multiple-word classes (i.e.. "main-content", or "mainContent)</li> <li>Use semantically correct tags- use H tags for headers, etc. Use strong and em tags instead of bold and italic tags.</li> <li>No inline CSS styles- all styles must be placed in an external stylesheet.</li> </ul>

<h4>CSS Specific</h4>

<ul> <li>Use CSS3 Media Queries to load different styles for each page. Do not build a different page for different device/layout.</li> <li>You may use SCSS in the project.</li> </ul>

<h4>Platform</h4>

<ul> <li>Desktop: IE11+, Latest Firefox, Latest Safari & Chrome Browsers (Mac & Windows).</li> <li>Primary Browser: IE11</li> </ul>

<h4>Challenge specific</h4> <ul> <li> App is same. Based on the Channel Type (Domestic or Export) the page will have different field. Same Bid Accept page. Will have different field based the Domestic or Export.<li> <li>Only a few fields will vary between Domestic and Export, but layout and action are same</li> <li> Bid Accept and Big request are same page. In Bid accept , the page only in view only mode and in Bid Request page, View and Edit mode is allowed. i.e, Edit button is enabled</li> <li>For every table, there will be Scroll bar for pagination and header should be fixed</li> <li>Previous tab and next tab for item list page and master page has to be implemented</li> <li>In the <b>specification document</b> L means label, and D means Dynamic</li> <li></li> </ul>

<h2>Application requirements</h2>

<div> <h4>Resources & links</h4>

<ol> <li>Wireframe Export: https://dcp-e.herokuapp.com/ . This can also be download from the scg-dcp git repo for local setup dcp-scgapp-Export. </li> <li>Wireframe Domestic: https://dcp-d.herokuapp.com/ . This can also be download from the scg-dcp git repo for local setup dcp-scgapp-Domestic. </li> <li><a href="https://software.topcoder.com/review/" target="_blank">Topcoder Online Review Portal</a></li> <li>Icons Lib: https://gitlab.com/beingjd/scg-dcp/tree/master/FrontendHtml/dcp-scgapp-Domestic/src/assets/images</li> </ol>

<h4>0. General</h4> <ol> <li>Use the <a href="https://gitlab.com/scg-dcp/scg-dcp-ui/tree/sprint-1">Sprint-1</a> branch as the base of your submission.</li> <li>Before start working on this task create a new branch <strong>Sprint-2.2</strong> & push this branch once the task is completed.</li> <li>Use the <code>MOCK_API_URL</code> enviroment variable defined in <code>environment.ts</code> to fetch JSON data using services.</li> <li>Footer of the pages should stick to bottom if a webpage has lesser content</li> <li>Login credindials are defined in the README.md file.</li> <li>For implemetinng <b>Sales (sls1)</b> user account pages, refer to the export wireframe: https://dcp-e.herokuapp.com/itemDetailsBitRequest </li> <li>For implemetinng <b>Customer support (csp1)</b>user pages, refer to the export wireframe: https://dcp-d.herokuapp.com/itemDetailsBitRequest </li> <li>Overall the layout of pages are same for these two user roles however there are differences in data.</li> </ol>

1. Scope

  1. The 40 fields specified in this document are in the scope of this task.
  2. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dYhZUNLFuXs3j3a5NNKKiuGAtkabYi23oeagIfNaL5s/edit#heading=h.206ipza
  3. Fields marked with MVP2 are out of scope.

2. <strong>Edit</strong> Order Management</h4>

  1. Ref: https://dcp-e.herokuapp.com/orderManagement & https://dcp-d.herokuapp.com/orderManagement
  2. URL for this page should be <code>.../s/orderManagement</code> when log in as Sales user
  3. URL for this page should be <code>.../c/orderManagement</code> when log in as Customer support user
  4. Follow the wireframe for the layout.

2.1 Items Tab (Domestic & Export)

  1. Ref: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dYhZUNLFuXs3j3a5NNKKiuGAtkabYi23oeagIfNaL5s/edit#heading=h.2p2csry
  2. At first, a user needs to select the table rows to be edited by checking the checkboxes. On clicking the edit icon on the upper right section https://d.pr/free/i/8DK9rX the selected rows should appear in edit mode.
  3. The type of edit control (textbox, drop-down...) for every field is defined in the document (section 1.2).
  4. For the drop-down options, make a request to the API server. Ref this for the API endpoint details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MP1Gd4HMsoTLVw4wVYdVLRki6VVwGRKPVW2Fdy4N0hs/edit?usp=sharing
  5. SAVE and Confirm operations specified in the document should also be implemented.

2.2 Info Tab (Domestic & Export)

  1. Ref: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dYhZUNLFuXs3j3a5NNKKiuGAtkabYi23oeagIfNaL5s/edit#heading=h.3o7alnk
  2. On clicking the edit icon the edit mode should appear.
  3. The type of edit control (textbox, drop-down...) for every field is defined in the document (section 1.2).
  4. For the drop-down options, make a request to the API server. Ref this for the API endpoint details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MP1Gd4HMsoTLVw4wVYdVLRki6VVwGRKPVW2Fdy4N0hs/edit?usp=sharing
  5. SAVE and Confirm operations specified in the document should also be implemented.

2.3 Pricing Tab (Domestic & Export)

  1. Ref: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dYhZUNLFuXs3j3a5NNKKiuGAtkabYi23oeagIfNaL5s/edit#heading=h.ihv636
  2. On clicking the edit icon in each of table row, the edit mode should appear.
  3. The type of edit control (textbox, drop-down...) for every field is defined in the document (section 1.2).
  4. For the drop-down options, make a request to the API server. Ref this for the API endpoint details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MP1Gd4HMsoTLVw4wVYdVLRki6VVwGRKPVW2Fdy4N0hs/edit?usp=sharing
  5. SAVE and Confirm operations specified in the document should also be implemented.

2.4 Partner Tab (Domestic & Export)

  1. Ref: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dYhZUNLFuXs3j3a5NNKKiuGAtkabYi23oeagIfNaL5s/edit#heading=h.41mghml
  2. On clicking the edit icon in each of table cells, the edit mode for that cell should appear.
  3. The type of edit control (textbox, drop-down...) for every field is defined in the document (section 1.2).
  4. For the drop-down options, make a request to the API server. Ref this for the API endpoint details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MP1Gd4HMsoTLVw4wVYdVLRki6VVwGRKPVW2Fdy4N0hs/edit?usp=sharing
  5. SAVE and Confirm operations specified in the document should also be implemented.

2.5 Text Tab (Domestic & Export)

  1. Ref: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dYhZUNLFuXs3j3a5NNKKiuGAtkabYi23oeagIfNaL5s/edit#heading=h.2grqrue
  2. On clicking the edit icon in each of table cells, the edit mode for that cell should appear.
  3. The type of edit control (textbox, drop-down...) for every field is defined in the document (section 1.2).
  4. For the drop-down options, make a request to the API server. Ref this for the API endpoint details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MP1Gd4HMsoTLVw4wVYdVLRki6VVwGRKPVW2Fdy4N0hs/edit?usp=sharing
  5. SAVE and Confirm operations specified in the document should also be implemented.

2.6 Date Tab (Domestic & Export)

  1. Ref: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dYhZUNLFuXs3j3a5NNKKiuGAtkabYi23oeagIfNaL5s/edit#heading=h.3fwokq0
  2. On clicking the edit icon in each of table row, the edit mode for that cell should appear.
  3. The type of edit control (textbox, drop-down...) for every field is defined in the document (section 1.2).
  4. For the drop-down options, make a request to the API server. Ref this for the API endpoint details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MP1Gd4HMsoTLVw4wVYdVLRki6VVwGRKPVW2Fdy4N0hs/edit?usp=sharing
  5. SAVE and Confirm operations specified in the document should also be implemented.

3. Validations

  1. Ref: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dYhZUNLFuXs3j3a5NNKKiuGAtkabYi23oeagIfNaL5s/edit#heading=h.4k668n3
  2. The validation details listed in the above document should be implemented.

4. Import and Export differences

  1. Ref: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dYhZUNLFuXs3j3a5NNKKiuGAtkabYi23oeagIfNaL5s/edit#bookmark=id.mguznvwlk0gk for the import and export differences

5. Verification document

Provide a verification document. In this document take the snapshot of the screens you created & add list the things you did. </div>

title: Distinguish the Partition mode and Part Set mode
body:
The following screens relate to a Part Set system, when the panel is in this mode then it can only be in one state at a time FULL SET/PART SET B/PART SET C/PART SET D/UNSET/ALARM/TAMPER etc…

The following screen relates to a Partition system, a partition system is effectively a collection of Part Set systems. Each partition operates independently.

When the panel is in this mode then each partition can only be in one state at a time FULL SET/PART SET/UNSET/ALARM/TAMPER etc…)

Eg.

Partition 1 – SET

Partition 2 – SET

Partition 3 – ALARM

Partition 4 – UNSET

title: Re-opened: Inactionable text is tabbable {ACCESS-5054}
body:
@suppermancool - Please see the latest updates in the comments below.

Details

  • Testing Platform: Windows Desktop
  • Steps to Reproduce: Using keyboard only tab through http://jobs-dev.qa.zeta.comcast.net:8000
  • Expected Results: Only links, buttons and form elements are tabbable
  • Actual Results: A long inactionable block of text is tabbable

Description

title: CCSP Catch 404 from Registered Classes Call
body:
The call out to this service: https://flex.plusone.com/api/FitnessClassSessions?userID=3032512&clientID=175&programID=991 To get the classes that user signed up for.

If that user is not signed up for any classes, that endpoint returns a 404. Can you update the CCSP code to catch the 404 and just return an empty array of classes? Right now, it’s returning the 404 to the app and the app is showing an error.

title: Update Job Description parsing to handle job_descriptions with no expected fields
body:
Today we saw that we can get job_description for a job that do not contain the expected we parse job_description to find the JOB DESCRIPTION, CORE RESPONSIBILITIES and JOB SPECIFICATION sections but they are not present. There is no <P>.

This task is to update our logic when rendering job descriptions to handle these scenarios. When we find this, we will take all of the contents of the job_description property and display them in the JOB DESCRIPTION section. We will hide the CORE RESPONSIBILITIES and JOB SPECIFICATION sections because they will have no contents.

title: Disable Portfolio and Value Stream Drop downs when in Edit roadmap view
body: When in edit mode for a specific roadmap a user can by mistake change the portfolio or value stream by selecting the value stream drop down and then hitting save. This ends up moving the data out of the roadmap and renaming it to another value stream roadmap. To prevent this from happening, disable the portfolio and value stream drop downs when in edit roadmap as there would be no reason for these drop downs to be enabled in edit given the user is not searching for roadmaps but editing a specific roadmap they selected. See attached file for screen print. Disable_dropdowns_in_Edit_Roadmap.docx

title: SCG-DCP - (Edit Item Details Bid Request)
body:
<p>Welcome to the "<strong>SCG-DCP challenge</strong>". In this challenge, we are looking for your great development skills to quickly develop an <strong>AngularJS</strong> application based on the given wireframe.<br />

<p><span style="color:rgb(0, 124, 52)">Let us know any question you have!</span></p>

<h2>General requirements</h2>

<h4>Layout</h4> <ul> <li>layout should be fluid</li> </ul>

<h4>Framework-specific</h4>

<ul> <li>Use JSON format files for the application data.</li> <li>Create services to fetch data from JSON format files.</li> </ul>

<h4>Code Formatting</h4>

<ul> <li>Please use clean INDENTATION for all HTML code so future developers can follow the code.</li> <li>Provide comments on the page elements to give a clear explanation of the code usage. The goal is to help future developers understand the code.</li> <li>Use appropriate linters to validate your code.</li> </ul>

<h4>HTML Specific</h4>

<ul> <li>HTML should be valid HTML5 compliant.</li> <li>All HTML code naming should not have any conflicts or errors.</li> <li>Element and Attribute names should be in lowercase and use a "-" or camel naming to separate multiple-word classes (i.e.. "main-content", or "mainContent)</li> <li>Use semantically correct tags- use H tags for headers, etc. Use strong and em tags instead of bold and italic tags.</li> <li>No inline CSS styles- all styles must be placed in an external stylesheet.</li> </ul>

<h4>CSS Specific</h4>

<ul> <li>Use CSS3 Media Queries to load different styles for each page. Do not build a different page for different device/layout.</li> <li>You may use SCSS in the project.</li> </ul>

<h4>Platform</h4>

<ul> <li>Desktop: IE11+, Latest Firefox, Latest Safari & Chrome Browsers (Mac & Windows).</li> <li>Primary Browser: IE11</li> </ul>

<h4>Challenge specific</h4> <ul> <li> App is same. Based on the Channel Type (Domestic or Export) the page will have different field. Same Bid Accept page. Will have different field based the Domestic or Export.<li> <li>Only a few fields will vary between Domestic and Export, but layout and action are same</li> <li> Bid Accept and Big request are same page. In Bid accept , the page only in view only mode and in Bid Request page, View and Edit mode is allowed. i.e, Edit button is enabled</li> <li>For every table, there will be Scroll bar for pagination and header should be fixed</li> <li>Previous tab and next tab for item list page and master page has to be implemented</li> <li>In the <b>specification document</b> L means label, and D means Dynamic</li> <li></li> </ul>

<h2>Application requirements</h2>

<div> <h4>Resources & links</h4>

<ol> <li>Wireframe Export: https://dcp-e.herokuapp.com/ . This can also be download from the scg-dcp git repo for local setup dcp-scgapp-Export. </li> <li>Wireframe Domestic: https://dcp-d.herokuapp.com/ . This can also be download from the scg-dcp git repo for local setup dcp-scgapp-Domestic. </li> <li><a href="https://software.topcoder.com/review/" target="_blank">Topcoder Online Review Portal</a></li> <li>Icons Lib: https://gitlab.com/beingjd/scg-dcp/tree/master/FrontendHtml/dcp-scgapp-Domestic/src/assets/images</li> </ol>

<h4>0. General</h4> <ol> <li>Use the <a href="https://gitlab.com/scg-dcp/scg-dcp-ui/tree/sprint-1">Sprint-1</a> branch as the base of your submission.</li> <li>Before start working on this task create a new branch <strong>Sprint-2.1</strong> & push this branch once the task is completed.</li> <li>Use the <code>MOCK_API_URL</code> enviroment variable defined in <code>environment.ts</code> to fetch JSON data using services.</li> <li>Footer of the pages should stick to bottom if a webpage has lesser content</li> <li>Login credindials are defined in the README.md file.</li> <li>For implemetinng <b>Sales (sls1)</b> user account pages, refer to the export wireframe: https://dcp-e.herokuapp.com/itemDetailsBitRequest </li> <li>For implemetinng <b>Customer support (csp1)</b>user pages, refer to the export wireframe: https://dcp-d.herokuapp.com/itemDetailsBitRequest </li> <li>Overall the layout of pages are same for these two user roles however there are differences in data.</li> </ol>

1. Scope

  1. The 40 fields specified in this document are in the scope of this task.
  2. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dYhZUNLFuXs3j3a5NNKKiuGAtkabYi23oeagIfNaL5s/edit#heading=h.206ipza
  3. Fields marked with MVP2 are out of scope.

2. <strong>Edit</strong> Item Details Bid Request</h4>

  1. Ref: https://dcp-e.herokuapp.com/itemDetailsBitRequest & https://dcp-d.herokuapp.com/itemDetailsBitRequest
  2. URL for this page should be <code>.../s/itemDetailsBitRequest</code> when log in as Sales user
  3. URL for this page should be <code>.../c/itemDetailsBitRequest</code> when log in as Customer support user
  4. Follow the wireframe for the layout.

2.1 Info Tab (Domestic & Export)

  1. Ref: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dYhZUNLFuXs3j3a5NNKKiuGAtkabYi23oeagIfNaL5s/edit#heading=h.3o7alnk
  2. On clicking the edit icon the edit mode should appear.
  3. The type of edit control (textbox, drop-down...) for every field is defined in the document (section 1.2).
  4. For the drop-down options, make a request to the API server. Ref this for the API endpoint details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MP1Gd4HMsoTLVw4wVYdVLRki6VVwGRKPVW2Fdy4N0hs/edit?usp=sharing
  5. SAVE and Confirm operations specified in the document should also be implemented.

2.2 Pricing Tab (Domestic & Export)

  1. Ref: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dYhZUNLFuXs3j3a5NNKKiuGAtkabYi23oeagIfNaL5s/edit#heading=h.ihv636
  2. On clicking the edit icon in each of table row, the edit mode should appear.
  3. The type of edit control (textbox, drop-down...) for every field is defined in the document (section 1.2).
  4. For the drop-down options, make a request to the API server. Ref this for the API endpoint details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MP1Gd4HMsoTLVw4wVYdVLRki6VVwGRKPVW2Fdy4N0hs/edit?usp=sharing
  5. SAVE and Confirm operations specified in the document should also be implemented.

2.3 Partner Tab (Domestic & Export)

  1. Ref: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dYhZUNLFuXs3j3a5NNKKiuGAtkabYi23oeagIfNaL5s/edit#heading=h.41mghml
  2. On clicking the edit icon in each of table cells, the edit mode for that cell should appear.
  3. The type of edit control (textbox, drop-down...) for every field is defined in the document (section 1.2).
  4. For the drop-down options, make a request to the API server. Ref this for the API endpoint details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MP1Gd4HMsoTLVw4wVYdVLRki6VVwGRKPVW2Fdy4N0hs/edit?usp=sharing
  5. SAVE and Confirm operations specified in the document should also be implemented.

2.4 Text Tab (Domestic & Export)

  1. Ref: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dYhZUNLFuXs3j3a5NNKKiuGAtkabYi23oeagIfNaL5s/edit#heading=h.2grqrue
  2. On clicking the edit icon in each of table cells, the edit mode for that cell should appear.
  3. The type of edit control (textbox, drop-down...) for every field is defined in the document (section 1.2).
  4. For the drop-down options, make a request to the API server. Ref this for the API endpoint details: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MP1Gd4HMsoTLVw4wVYdVLRki6VVwGRKPVW2Fdy4N0hs/edit?usp=sharing
  5. SAVE and Confirm operations specified in the document should also be implemented.

3. Validations

  1. Ref: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dYhZUNLFuXs3j3a5NNKKiuGAtkabYi23oeagIfNaL5s/edit#heading=h.4k668n3
  2. The validation details listed in the above document should be implemented.

4. Import and Export differences

  1. Ref: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dYhZUNLFuXs3j3a5NNKKiuGAtkabYi23oeagIfNaL5s/edit#bookmark=id.mguznvwlk0gk for the import and export differences

5. Verification document

Provide a verification document. In this document take the snapshot of the screens you created & add list the things you did. </div>

title: If device don't support fingerprint then don't enable it
Amenities / Around Campus - Make More Dynamic
body:
The Around Campus section of the app was supposed to have 2 sections of content, Food & Drink, and Lodging. The client has removed Lodging. This is fine except of the minor issue here: https://gitlab.com/hercules-campus/campus-app-nextgen/blob/develop/www/templates/AmenitiesView.handlebars#L44

If we blank out the section for Around Campus > Wellness and just try to keep Food & Drink, the color block for the 2nd section still shows up:

Dynamic Loading

One of the ways we tried to fix the issue was to make a new doc def and get rid of the wellness section. This causes the app to fail because it's looking for both major sections to be defined in the json response. Don't rebuild the section, but just make the page setup calls a little safer to allow for the doc def to change and it not break the load. I believe this should just involve checks around the calls to filter out amenities based on the date filter here: https://gitlab.com/hercules-campus/campus-app-nextgen/blob/develop/www/js/collections/AmenitiesCollection.js#L17 But I'm not sure about that..

In this ticket, please do the following:

  • [ ] Fix the color bar issue
  • [ ] If this is also the same type of issue, fix this as well: https://gitlab.com/hercules-campus/campus-app-nextgen/blob/develop/www/templates/AmenitiesView.handlebars#L55
  • [ ] Investigate and fix the headless cms call to make it more dynamic. You should be able to create a new doc def, delete wellness as a section, and the app should still load.

title: Handle refresh token in API calls
body:
@suppermancool - We are now going to handle token refresh in the services. This is going to require two changes in the front-end:

  1. For each API call after login, we're going to send a RefreshToken header, with the contents of the refresh token value received at login
  2. When the API determines that the token needs to be refreshed, it will refresh the token in the API call and will send down a new set of tokens as a set-cookie header

This service changes hasn't been deployed yet in dev, but it hopefully will be in the next day or so.

title: Frontend Calling ADFS Endpoint Twice
body:
@elkhawajah - See the attached log files. What looks to be happening is that the call to /callback with the code is happening twice, as far as I can tell.

  1. The first time, when we use the callback token to get the access and refresh tokens, it works fine
  2. The second time, we're given the same callback token that's already been used in 1. This time it fails

What I'm hoping we can do is determine if a given token is a duplicate somehow and just ignore the second callback and have it complete successfully, even if a second callback call happens. Ideally, the cookies / session would be available in the second call, so we can just ignore it if needed and redirect the user without doing anything. Otherwise I'm not sure how we'll store / validate a duplicate token.

Do you think that's doable?

redirects.txt

title: Slight delay in rendering header for logged in users
body:
@suppermancool - What we'd like to do here is to see if there's anything we can optimise in the current implementation. I know ideally we would have this be implemented in the Dust file, and we're asking the client if there's a good way to do that, but for now, let's see if we can also fix the client-side JS implementation. Maybe we just hide the Login button completely until we know whether or not to show it? That way it will just be delayed in showing up instead of showing and then disappearing.

When a user is logged in and is navigating the site, the header is checking each time before it renders if the user is logged in. It defaults to assume they are not - showing the Login button - and then if the call to see if they are logged in is successful, the header is updated to show the name and not the button.

The issue on this is that if there is any slowness to this call, the user will see this transition as they navigate the site. This was mentioned by the client today.

The request for this ticket is - can we do anything about this? Can we either optimize the speed of these such that it happens so quickly it is not readily noticable or adjust things to mitigate the issue?

title: Recurring Event Issue (CCSP)
body:
From Slack

The events coming back from zeta, when there’s a recurring event, all have the same IDs… this is apparently causing an issue when you click on the event in the UI. You’re already creating events out of the recurring events… can you just update the ID to be <eventid + '-' + unixtime(startdatetime)> or something like that so the event ids are unique? (edited) i don’t know if we should do a hyphen, underscore, or just string concat them but they need to be unique for the ui to work correctly

More Detail

right now, if there’s a recurring event, if you click on an event in the list/calendar view to view the details, it’s seemingly random which event you get. From the client:

There are recurring events in Zeta for June 17th, July 17th, and August 17th. What Nehal noticed is that when he added Jun 17th event, it actually added to the calendar on Aug 17th and not june...

I think the recurring event we tested was a daily recurring event, and clicking on, say, June 6th and it bringing up June 7th wasn’t very noticeable. But when it’s off by a month, it is..

I can’t use that MR you just made. the app is already pending deploy. we can’t send them a new build. That’s why I asked for CCSP

title: The delay of iOS video streaming increases longer and longer
body:
After 10-20 minutes, the delay of iOS video streaming increases longer and longer (30 seconds - 1 min). This issue is not always reproducible but easy to reproduce.

This issue was observed on both WebDriverAgent Inspector and STF.

Even sometimes the video streaming doesn't show up, and I have to refresh the page of WebDriverAgent Inspector or STF to make it work again.

See this video for reference: https://youtu.be/eB-5-QGwAi8

Look, in the beginning, I operated on my iPad and the screen of STF didn't show up the screen change, it always stopped at the previous Youtube screen. But after I refresh the STF page, then the screen synchronized.

title: Speed up Optum Events
body:
I'm changing this issue. I'm not positive how this currently works, I'm going to write out how it should work here and we can discuss.

The Cordova app should call the userSearch Optum API only if there isn't a userId stored in the Cordova app SecureStorage. CCSP shouldn't call out to Optum User Search at all.

Steps the app should take

  1. First time the user visits the calendar, if the userId is not stored in secure storage, call the Optum API to get the userId from the userSearchUrl
    • OR this can be done in the background possibly (async) on login. DO NOT BLOCK the login for this call. Only question here is what happens if the user logs in and goes to the calendar before their userId comes back.
  2. When userId comes back, store it in secure storage along with the NTID and PERNR
  3. Use this userId for all calls to CCSP, and not call userSearch at all

Tasks

  • [x] Update the CCSP API to accept userId in requests where it's needed
  • [x] Update the app to match the steps above
  • [x] Update the CCSP userSearch to be POST instead of PATCH. Zeta cannot proxy a PATCH REST call. The call from CCSP to Optum should still be PATCH, but from Cordova to Zeta it should be POST
  • [x] Add this UserID to the Settings > Debug screen

  1. Update the data loaders to get the data into the DW, Dynamo, etc. so it's available in the API.

  3. Here is what the current profile page looks like for a Code challenge: https://www.topcoder-dev.com/members/sky_/details/?track=DEVELOP&subTrack=CODE Note that we don't show anything for ratings, including distribution and rating history.

  4. Here is what the profile pages look like for a rating challenge type: https://www.topcoder-dev.com/members/Sky_/details/?track=DEVELOP&subTrack=ASSEMBLY_COMPETITION Note the different data that is displayed. Specifically, the ratings charts.

title: Search panel component
body:
NOTE

The marvelapp link has been updated, so please make sure to follow the new template.

On the main landing page is a search panel. We want to turn this into a component that can be added on the landing page.

Early component

This will be one of the first components of the site, so please ensure that all CSS and JS is created in an extensible way that we can build on for other components as well.

The goal is to have a new "Jobs Landing Page Search" component that I can drag into a page to show the search panel.

Formats

Please ensure the panel scales to desktop, tablet, and phone layouts, as described in the MarvelApp links in the README. We will still be using general components, like rows, columns, and general layout components from the "generic" Zeta components, so please ensure your component doesn't break anything in those other components. Feel free to look at the existing comcast and generic components to get an idea of how to build out these new ones.

Storyboards

The storyboards can be found here:

https://gitlab.com/hercules-jobs/storyboards

Data

The current location drop-down should be loaded from a JSON file for now via AJAX. Clicking "GO" will go to the search page (/search)

Scope

For to display the below count down clock first app need to hit the API for Setting, in response if we receive the following response

Please use time-to-exit property to identify whether to show exit timer or not.

Note: App’s partition exit timer should only be initialized by the value from the cloud/panel and not the default one.

e.g if some panel has exit timer set to 20sec , then timer should start from 20s value.

Now please note

  • First we need to display a confirmation popup
  • If user confirm and proceed forward then we need to send API request for Setting
  • If in response on that request we have time-to-exit property (and more then 1) then show the clock with the time mentioned here
  • Lets take and example if value of time-to-exit property is 30, then after 30 second dont do any action
  • But If user clicks Cancel button before 30 second is over, then send an API request with unset for the same panel

Use this Panel: Y28GRFiaO64a7k7ApSravg has been changed to provide “exit” state and time-to-exit
