title: Header creation
body:
On each page in the MarvelApp is a common header. We want to build a component for this header that can be added to DocDefs in Vagrant as we build out the site.

First component

This will be the first component of the site, so please ensure that all CSS and JS is created in an extensible way that we can build on for other components as well.

The goal is to have a new "Jobs Header" component that I can drag into a page to show the header.

Formats

Please ensure the header scales to desktop, tablet, and phone layouts, as described in the MarvelApp links in the README. We will still be using general components, like rows, columns, and general layout components from the "generic" Zeta components, so please ensure your component doesn't break anything in those other components. Feel free to look at the existing comcast and generic components to get an idea of how to build out these new ones.

Sub-menus

The marvel app links describe sub menus for About Us and Life at Comcast. Please ensure those work for the component.

Scrolling

Note that, when scrolling in the MarvelApp, the header stays at the top of the page.

Storyboards

The storyboards can be found here:

https://gitlab.com/hercules-jobs/storyboards

Scope

title: Jobs footer
body:
On each page in the MarvelApp is a common footer. We want to build a component for this footer that can be added to DocDefs in Vagrant as we build out the site.

First component

This will be one of the first components of the site, so please ensure that all CSS and JS is created in an extensible way that we can build on for other components as well.

The goal is to have a new "Jobs Footer" component that I can drag into a page to show the footer at the bottom of the page.

Formats

Please ensure the footer scales to desktop, tablet, and phone layouts, as described in the MarvelApp links in the README. We will still be using general components, like rows, columns, and general layout components from the "generic" Zeta components, so please ensure your component doesn't break anything in those other components. Feel free to look at the existing comcast and generic components to get an idea of how to build out these new ones.

Sub-menus

The marvel app links describe sub menus for About Us and Life at Comcast. Please ensure those work for the component.

Storyboards

The storyboards can be found here:

https://gitlab.com/hercules-jobs/storyboards

Scope

title: Required instructors and Instructor Buffer on Product page
body:
• This is need applied for different Assignment Grouping for number of required instructors or instructor buffer

  • Count the number of Required Instructors:

    • If Scheduling Pattern is Daily then it's this number instructors for each day
    • If Scheduling Pattern is Specific then the requirement of instructors is to match the reservation date and times - default is 1
    • For another Scheduling Pattern (Any, Weekly and Monthly) then it's the number of instructors for all of the dates combined.

  • Instructor Buffer and Date Specific Buffer

    • This is the number of "Reserved" instructors by system. This allows the user to "hold" a number of instructors from being assigned/booked by the capacity in the system for a specific date.
    • User needs the ability to add or subtract instructor count for each individual product by specific dates that are applicable to the "base" schedule for the specific product.
    • Example Private lessons have a buffer of - 2 instructors. This means the system automatically saves two random instructors from showing available to a reservationist for booking.
    • Example in group lessons the total instructors needed by day is 7 instructors. But the buffer can be set to +3 - which allows the user to increase the number of staff needed to be 10
    • Buffer need calculated/show up on the Scheduler Page

title: Missing calendar dates in list view
body: When viewing the calendar in list view, when you scroll to the bottom, as the page refreshes, the next day that should be listed is missing. When app makes a call to events service, it passes first set of date with start date Apr 27th and end date Apr 30th. Then when you scroll down to the bottom, it makes a call with start date May 1st and end date as May 4th. The problem that happens is that events with start date Apr 30th do not show up in either of the queries and are entirely missed. They show up when you select Apr 30th in the calendar view (not list view) because in that case we call the service with start date Apr 30th and end date May 1st. We may probably need to overlap our queries - Apr 27 to Apr 30, Apr 30 to May 3, May 3 to May 6 and so on.
